[[VIDEOID:b7177dd6e88eb6af10bd9dfeb033702a]] This 150w power inverter is small, I mean it's smaller than the palm of my hand. It does have 2 USB charging ports and a power outlet. You connect this to the car's 12v adapter and it will generate 150w of power but you do have to make sure your cars battery is producing a bit more than 12v. My SUV battery produces 14v and so this power inverter works just fine.

I have attached some Image / Video, it might not show up right away. Amazon has since change the way how they process these and when it will show up on the reviews. Please be patience. Thank You.

I was offered this free sample item for evaluation.

Silicon Devices® - 150 Watt High-Performance Auto Power Inverter. Excellent inverter with a great price! I originally bought the BESTEK 300W Dual 110V AC Outlets Power Inverter do to the reviews but I returned it because the fan runs all the time. The Silicon Devices inverter is well made with an aluminum body which helps keep it cool so the fan only comes on once in a while or not at all if the power load is light and if the power load is heavy and the Silicon inverter heats up only then does the fan come on and rapidly cools off the inverter then shuts back off. I tested it for about 4 hours on a 100 watt load and it handled it easily and the fan only come on for a few seconds until it cooled off the inverter then the fan shut off. The Silicon 150 watt inverter plugs into the cars outlet like the 300 watt Bestek but I would not put over 150 watts through my trucks outlet, not a good idea. A 300 watt inverter should connect directly to the battery not through a lighter plug. 150 watts runs everything that I need to run and doesn't suck up unnecessary power for a fan that runs constantly.

I bought this after looking and trying out several inverter on my own and didn't get a discount or promotion I just decided to give it a try and I am glad.
Please believe me that the Silicon 150 watt inverter is a perfect choice for a car plug in inverter it work perfectly.

[[VIDEOID:be7fe7e1b89e5ec05665f3ec6300d3e1]] Well, I've only Just ordered the product and haven't used it yet (I'll add the stars for that part later) but I will say that I was surprised to see how...small? it is. I dunno, based on the pictures and the way it was described by online influencers, I thought it was this enormous tub of latex, lol.

I have a bottle of liquid latex from Pueen that's running low, in pink, which is why I ordered this particular color (wanted to stay consistent), and I'll pour some of this in there (once it's empty; don't wanna mix the latex types) just to make using it easier and so it doesn't dry out from opening the lid frequently.
Purchased for use with messy nail art clean up. Works better than most. Leaves a pink stain for a few minutes after peel.

I do a lot of nail art that includes stamping, sponging and a bunch of other really messy designs. My problem is that when I do all of those things the polish gets all over my skin making clean up take a bit longer than I like. So I needed to find something that could help with that problem. In comes this liquid latex!

I ordered one in the hopes that it would help with keeping the skin around my nails clean while I'm doing those messy manicures. I cleaned out an empty nail polish bottle and filled it up with this liquid latex. Then I used the brush from the nail polish bottle to apply the liquid latex to the skin around my nails. I gave it a few minutes to dry then did my manicure. Once done with the manicure I used a little nail polish remover on a brush to make sure none of the latex was attached to the polish on my nail (don't want to ruin the manicure by pulling the polish on my nail off with the latex). Then, using tweezers, I pulled the latex off of each finger. For the most part it came off easily leaving clean up much easier with less to clean.

This was a lifesaver! I am very pleased with this liquid latex. The only thing I don't like about it is the smell, it's almost a fishy smell. It is very strong at first when applying. Once dried the smell does dissipate for the most part so it doesn't bother me that much.

Disclaimer: I am not affiliated with the seller or this product and am under no obligation to provide a positive review nor do I receive any sort of compensation one way or the other. This review is my own opinion and should be viewed and treated as such. If my review was at all helpful to you please click the relevant button, thank you.

Love the ease of doing my nails at home with less chemicals!

What a great idea! I used suggestions from reviewer “mom of 4” with some exceptions. I did not use any OPI branded products to prep my nails. OPI nas 99 is just 99% isopropyl alcohol so I just used that. MUCH cheaper! (Buy it at the dollar store!) I also used Gelish PH Bond Prep as that is what I had.

I watched some You Tube vids before applying the nail guards. I saw that most of the posters used some kind of tool to press down the nail guards and later discovered a silicone nail tool was what I saw; I almost bought one but ended up with really good results using the eraser end of a new pencil. Now, don’t despair if you don’t apply the nail guards perfectly! Mine were rather wrinkledy but the wrinkles were covered by the builder gel. I also found the guards wrinkled much less when I applied them from the cuticle end and put some traction on the tip end, pulling the guard down over my fingertip gluing to my finger skin before filing the excess. Make sure you file DOWN and not across to remove the excess nail guard. That’s a mistake I made when I first applied these. Don’t worry if you mess up the application of these guards. A few times I had to remove the guard just placed as I completely trashed it on the application. I found that instead of breaking into another card, I could just use two smaller guards to completely cover my billboard-sized nails.

While searching nail videos, I stumbled on Liz at The Nail Hub. If you have not seen her videos, do yourself a favor and watch some. She showed a “pushing” technique in which the gel is laid down on the middle of the nail then pushed towards the cuticle end and sidewalls of the nail, flattening the nail brush. I tried this and it resulted in a much thinner amount of product in those areas with a more natural looking nail at the end.

I used In.Hype Camouflage Pink UV Builder Gel rather than the OPI branded product (it was half the cost) laying down two very thin coats and curing each coat for 90 seconds. Then I applied two coats of my color – curing each for 60 seconds. I’m currently in love with Allenbelle chameleon thermic color 5738, a light pink to dark pink temperature changing glitter polish. I then used one coat of Gelish Top It Off as that is what I had, curing for 90 seconds. My manicure lasts perfectly for two weeks which is about as long as I can stand it before the grow-out starts to bug me. When I’m ready to redo my manicure I just pry the polish off with the paddle end of an orange stick dipped in polish remover. The polish pops right off with absolutely NO damage to my natural nails! The popped off polish looks like a press-on nail!

I applied gel nail polish for years but got tired of the soaking and scraping technique to get the polish off, which also damaged my nail beds. So I went back to regular nail polish for a few years. This wasn’t really a fix, as a regular polish manicure lasts less than a week for me before the polish chips or I just peel it off. Now I can have a long-lasting mani that doesn’t ruin my natural nails! YAY for nail guards!

I love that I can do my own gel nails over the top of the nail guards.  When I clean my nails with alcohol and use the ph adjuster on my nails before applying the nail guards, my gel nails stay on for two weeks!  This is incredible!  The lady at Sally Beauty Supply didn't believe me!  Then, it is very easy to pry the nails off.  They never pop off because of the adhesive on the nail guards.
Easy to apply and easy to remove. I also use when applying gels and acrylics and really helps to protect nail bed. No more soaking nails with acetone or polish remover. Luv these!

I used this under some powder dip and it was very easy. Pull over the end of your nail and file. My dip lasted 8 days the longest with these specifically and removal, I gently lifted the side and used and toothpick with some acetone to weekend the adhesive and wha-la

Soaking in acetone weekly was KILLING my hands... I've been using these for weeks now and LOVE them! I use phprep before putting them on, then do my Sparkle & Co dip application, and haven't had ANY issues (no pop offs)! My hands look SO much healthier & I still get to change up my mani weekly!

These guards are really great! There is no damage to your nail when removing and they stay in place when product is applied (gel, press on, etc.). I do a lot of work with my hands (occupational and family) and my nails remain in tack.

I can't believe these aren't more popular! I LOVE these!! I've tried so many different items for putting my hair up quickly and easily, and these BY FAR blow away all the competition! Two came in a package, and I flip my hair up, put one prong on top, and one prong on the bottom. Stays in literally all day. They've lasted me for probably at least a year now. The black coating does chip off a bit, but it's not even really noticeable, since the majority of the prong is covered by your hair. They will bend a little (from side-to-side and not in a scrunchy fashion) if you're really trying to cram them in, but they go right back in place. I have bent mine so many times, and they've not broken yet. :) Anyway, love 'em, wish more people loved 'em, because I have no clue what I'll use if mine ever do break. I adore these things to pieces.

I'm going to have to stock up on these things; I bought a pack from the Bullseye store at lunch today, and my coworker saw me playing with my hair. She loved it so much she took my other one haha! They do come with two in a package, so it's a great deal and you won't have to fight a friend to get it back. Enjoy!

I got these after watching this YouTube video from this Youtuber who tested this out.
[...] my hair is a little shorter than hers and I'm working on growing it out from a pixie cut, so I have a bunch of crazy weird layers in my hair. I needed an alternative to the typical elastic hair tie to throw my hair up. I'm afraid I wear my hair up so often that I probably have a big line of breakage across my hair from where the hair tie goes. This is that perfect item I was looking for. It's easy and I get multiple looks out of it. It's even fancier than just popping my hair up in a pony tail, so I don't feel obligated to fix my hair before I go out if I've had it up with this device. Sometimes some of my shorter strands do fall out of this, but that is because those strands are barely long enough for an elastic- not this products fault! I'm so glad one of these recommended beauty tools actually works!!!

If you have reasonably thick or long hair, have zero time/patience/skill and are looking for a quick way to look presentable for work, this comb/pin thing is great. I haven't tried all the styles pictured but I often wear a low "knot" style bun, and this thing keeps it in place as well or better than other methods I've tried (including using a a gazillion bobby pins, or a couple of  those "corkscrew" pins) and in less time. It takes a bit of judgement to wedge it in comfortably without the prongs pushing against your scalp. One star off because it's pretty large (the ends will show unless you have a LOT of hair) and because I've noticed the two central prongs do deform a bit with use. You can easily bend them back so that all 4 prongs are parallel again - but I suspect over time the metal will fatigue. But with two units in the pack, you have a backup if one breaks.

I'm always looking for simple but pretty ways to pull my hair up so I decided to try this. It's basically a gigantic bobby pin on steroids, 4 thick metal prongs that are curved to follow the shape of your head. I found the written instructions confusing but searched on YouTube and found some videos that explain it well. Once I got the hang of it I was able to do the messy bun style in about a minute.

My hair is fine and slippery, and I have a lot of layers, so there is some hair poking out when I do it, but it's much better than what I would be able to achieve with bobby pins. I expect it will work better once my hair grows out a bit. You can make these hairstyles as tight or as loose as you want depending on how much hair you gather in the pin as you flip it, so it's good for those that have a lot of hair to wrangle as well as those who get headaches if their hair is pulled back tightly. If you have past your shoulders that is wavy or curly (like the model in the diagrams) I think that is ideal, but I think you can make it work with most hair types.

For less than $5 for a 2-pack it's worth a try, and if it doesn't work for you, pass it on to a friend with a different hair length/texture.

Finally something that really works and no more elastic band ridge in the hair when I let it down.  I have thick wavy (frizzy) hair that's layered. I use BOTH pins, one for top, shorter layers and the other for the longer bottom layers. It creates a classy up do. I take it down from the pins and it has cool retro waves reminiscent of 1930s and it's not frizzy.

So, I was asked to give an unbiased review of this product in exchange for receiving it free of charge. I had no idea what I would get and whether or not it would be useful to me. Well, I can say that I received the product as indicated, on time. The packaging was perfect; no rips, tears, gouging, etc. There was appropriate use of "bubble" wrap in the box, and the product itself was unharmed during the shipping process.

When I opened the box and saw the clips I realized they were just what I needed. My car has lost a couple of them during the getting in and getting out process. They fit perfectly and appear to be quite sturdy, and they were easy to install. I don't claim to be an expert on cars, or know anyone that is, but I do know quality product when I see it, and this is definitely quality.

As for communication with the company; it was superb. I initially had difficulty getting to the discount code and registering for the product. The owner was right on it and stayed connected with me until it was resolved; which didn't take long at all.

In closing, I recommend this product, and will be looking for other products to try out conceptualized/manufactured by this company.

The Skederm Ultimate eye cream has been working really well for me.

MY EXPERIENCE: I have some wrinkles around my eyes and dark circles. I’ve noticed an improvement in the area. The moisture benefit alone has helped minimize the appearance of wrinkles. I’ve also noticed that the skin looks brighter and healthier, like it has more elasticity. This moisturizer really penetrates deep into the skin cells rather than sitting on top of the skin. I can tell that my skin absorbs the moisturizer because it doesn’t leave an oily feeling and the skin feels a lot better.

BENEFITS: This has retinol, which is one of the few active ingredients for treating wrinkles. I’ve reacted badly to some retinol treatments in the past, but this one has worked well. The ceramide helps to retain a moisture barrier on the skin to prevent it from drying out. Collagen is what gives us that youthful appearance, so I always look for it in my moisturizers.

So far (after excitedly trying all of them on right after each other) I really like these headbands! The colors and patterns are so cute. The striped ones are a silkier fabric while the floral printed ones are a more textured fabric. These don't stretch all the way around your head like many headbands do, you have to stretch it over your head around where you want it to be and then style your hair from there. Not the best pick for a quick hair fix, perhaps a standard elastic headband would be best for that! They seem to be pretty sturdy on the head; a lot of headbands can tend to slip around or even fall off. I didn't wear these for a long time, but I tested their strength by moving my head around and they stayed pretty much in place. They are a tad bit more narrow than I had anticipated, but you can sort of splat out the fabric if you like a wider headband like me. I attached a few of the pictures I took while trying them out. I love how they look with my hair both up and down! It adds a touch of flair and class to even a simple bun. Overall I really like these. They fit the style I was looking for with a great price. Definitely recommend!

First off, these are adorable and they smell great! I loved them. I used two at a time.e to make the water darker. You'll need to rinse the tub really well afterwards, they do leave a little bit of residue behind but nothing bad, no skin staining or anything crazy. I loved them.

These are great for the price.  Is it as good as the $10 black man bombs? No way! But for $16 you get 12 of these guys so you gotta lower your expectations.  1 makes the water black but very translucent with no stains.  2 makes the water much blacker and less translucent but still a little see through and starts to leave black marks inside the tub.  3 is nearly opaque and really leaves a lot of black marks behind.  Keep in mind it’s not staining your tub at all!! It’s staining the soap scum so all you need to do is clean your tub.  If you notice you get black marks on your tub with even 1 bomb you either have a very old tub or have not cleaned it in awhile.  Any marks that may occur on skin easily scrub off.  Finally these don’t really fizz much so you have to physically slosh the water around to make the black even.  Hope this helps someone.  Enjoy your bath :)

Normally people will just put a couple eye drops in their eyes and call it a day and that gets the job done. But this product is a whole different beast when it comes to eye cleaning and lubrication. I have chronic dry eye that bothers me often enough where I always have eye drops on hand. I also wear makeup enough where some of the grossness will get into my eye and stay there. So needless to say there is a good amount of buildup inside my eyes I don’t see. I started using this product once a week and it makes your eyes feel clean (which sounds weird but if you experience it you will understand). There is no stinging sensation and all you have to do is open your eye in the solution and look around for like 30 seconds. It feels weird but also good at the same time. Pro's first I guess:
- Sturdy and well made. It was relatively easy to put together once it arrived, but somewhat cumbersome trying to do so alone. Assembly involves raising up the back seat from the bottom portion (Akin to folding up the back seat of a car) and sliding on the arm bolts into a groove, attaching the hoses, rotating it onto a metal beam, and screwing in a screw into the wooden beams of the arm through a hole in the seat.
- The S-Beam thing was pretty powerful, so it is definitely capable of doing that "deep tissue" massage on your back but is more of a Con in this case (Will describe later)
- Leg supports were "extendable" (according to the exact words of the images on the product) in that if you pushed hard enough, the spring loaded support would give out a bit and allow the leg segment to go out a bit. If you didn't apply constant pressure, it would spring back into place (somewhat of a con / misleading feature advertisement)

Now for the Cons:
- The biggest and most glaring issue is that this thing *caused* more pain than helped it. The S-Track system they have in place is falsely advertised in their product video and images showing the track going all the way down to the hips / buttocks. This is not even remotely the case. It stops right at the lower back. I have attached a screenshot of their product demonstration video and a red line indicating exactly where the S-Track system *actually* goes down to. In addition to the fact that the massage is not complete, this is compounded by the fact that the product description lists the width of the rollers as "adjustable" This is also *not* the case as there is no method to do so from the user's controller. The rollers DO adjust outwards and inwards, but this is a feature of the massage, not something that the user can control to suit their needs. A bit of deliberate misleading on their part, if you ask me.
- As stated before, the S-Track system isn't at all what it advertised as. We also had no indication of this "Body Scan" feature working as intended. The instructions state that when you turn on the unit, it scans your body. There is no LED / Indicator / noise / alert / etc. indicating that this is taking place. When we turned on the unit it just immediately going into a default massage mode. There were no buttons to invoke this feature manually, nor any way to adjust the body settings. You get a rudimentary "Massage Type", "Intensity Setting" and a "manual mode" where you can direct the S-Track to a specific spot up or down the track. Thats all.
- The Air pouches that are used are WAY too strong. I had this thing turned all they way down on the "Intensity" setting and the air pouches were still cutting off circulation of our wrists on both myself and my fiance who used it. The feeling is akin to placing your entire arm in one of those blood pressure arm cuffs filled to the maximum - It is not enjoyable and it does not feel relaxing, it just borderline hurts and feels like someone is squeezing your arm. There is a video review by TJ that said the same thing, so it certainly isn't just our unit.
- There is another set of air bags that attempt to press on your shoulders, which actually did feel nice, but the sheer force on the bags hold you in place unless you make a concentrated effort to get out - this wound up causing problems later on when the S-Track got to the upper back / neck area as the rollers were so far forward for the massage it was genuinely stabbing us in the back with the air bags keeping us held in place unable to relieve the pressure of the rollers digging into our spine. The situation is hard to describe in words sadly, but effectively think it of as someone digging their elbows into your back as hard as they can with another person holding you in place unable to move - in most situations on massage chairs you can just arch your back a bit to get off the rollers until its in a more comfortable spot... You cannot do that while the shoulder bags are inflated as they hold you down pretty well. A relatively fit person like myself can get out of it easily, but this might not be the case for people purchasing this unit for medical reasons / disabilities, or for the elderly = Just something to keep in mind.
- There were no pre-drilled holes in the chair where you were required to put the screws. I triple checked the instructions to ensure what I was about to do was correct.... You must force the provided screws through the leather lining and into the wood beams inside the arm segments manually. I was not happy that I would be potentially tearing / ruining the leather to follow their instructions. If I need a screw there, pre-drill it during manufacturing.
- Chair has built in speakers on the arm units, but I have no knowledge on how to use them, nor were they listed in the instructions. There was no instructions to download any apps for the unit, nor did I see any bluetooth devices on my phone pop up while in discovery mode, so they seem to be for the chair itself, but we never heard anything aside from some female voice in what I assume to be French when we plugged the thing in the wall. There were no 3 millimeter jacks or any other type of audio jack on the chair itself.

Problems specifically related to the *SELLER* and not the chair:
There were numerous shipping issues we encountered with the third party seller here. Not only did we receive our chair, but we received half of another customer who also bought this chair in my area. We contacted the company that delivered it and we made them aware of the mistake but they had told us the earliest they can come back would be in another 2 weeks and we would have to hold on to it until then - despite that they had just been to my residence 3 hours ago. So essentially I was stuck with a 120 pound box that was about 6 feet in length in the middle of my living room. Luckily I found the intended recipients Name, Address, and Phone number and gave him a call. He was happy to come pick it up from my residence. I didn't have to wait 2 weeks to get it out of my house, and he didn't have to wait 2 weeks to get something he had paid for. The fact that the recipient had to pick up his own delivery from me because the company would not fix it in a timely manner was unacceptable. During the return process for this, I ended up having to call Amazon support today because they had come to pick it up July 9th (July 25 at time of writing) and I had not been refunded my payment even though the product was picked up from my residence more than 2 weeks ago. The support agent called them and confirmed that they had the product, but it has been sitting in the warehouse for a week and was scheduled to be sent back to the retailer sometime soon - effectively artificially delaying my refund until after the due date of my first payment on this. Props to Amazon though as the agent processed the refund for me anyway, as she confirmed they had gotten the product back from me and the third party company were just being slow. Otherwise I would be missing a credit card payment on my Amazon card for a product I technically didn't owe money for anymore.

Overall, we were not happy with this unit at all as we were suffering more pain simply using it than dealing with our existing pain so we returned it. The headache alone from the delivery company responsible for this seller is more than enough for us to void any future consideration of these products.

Great toothbrush, need small compact head I can’t use the regular head. I have a really hard time finding toothbrushes. I use a battery operated and use these after meals for a quick brush on my teeth. Use battery operated mornings and nights manual in between for fresh breath and clean teeth. My smile has whitened quite a bit!

My favorite manual toothbrush for traditional metal braces (Iconix champagne gold). The bristles are long and soft and the head of the brush is slim enough to reach the very back teeth. I had four premolars removed and the bristles are able to reach the gum between the gaps as they slowly close. I combine these with an electric toothbrush, floss threaders, Listerine floss, and ACT mouth rinse and both my orthodontist and dentist are pleased with my braces hygiene routine. One brush lasts about two months (metal braces are very hard on the bristles). I plan to continue buying these even after my braces come off because they are so pleasant to use.

I waisted my money.  Opened it and it was identical to my worn out one, except the brushing head was noticeably shorter, by about a third.  I thought, they downgraded the product, but later, found them inside a store and those were the size as my old one.  I would think this item was a child's  size, but it is not advertised as such and the handle is the same length as my other tooth brushes.
Really gets under the wire of my daughters braces.  Small tip helps get those back teeth nice and clean.  A must for ortho patients!  Highly recommend!

I fainted and lost a tooth. Getting an implant. I’m 76.  Background.  Dental surgeon said brush teeth up and down due largely, I think., to the gaping hole in front.  Coincidentally my husband was given this very toothbrush at our dentist’s office.  The difference in my teeth and gums is mind numbingly wonderful. My gums are growing back where they belong and the toothbrush is an excellent flosser. Brushing up and down takes practice, but is well worth the effort in my experience.
Love them! Very soft with your gums and teeth but still you can feel how they clean very well your teeth!

My dentist gives out this exact toothbrush and finally I found them online so I don’t have to wait 6 months for a trip to the dentist to enjoy a fresh new toothbrush. Plus with COVID19, I like trading out my toothbrush much more often for good hygiene.

The product packaging looked the same (except the barcode label and code, see photo), but the silicone sponges felt more stiff than the first batch. To be sure it was not just my imagination in unfairly comparing a "new" product to a "used" product, I asked my daughter (who felt the first pack when it arrived) to feel them, too. She too, said they do feel different. They still work, but I was just not as amazed about them as with the first batch. I won't give them out as a gift now.

So I was very skeptical about buying this product, as I wasn't planning on returning it to China (shipping hassle, takes forever, etc). However, after about 30 minutes of playing with the heat settings, I'm happy to say I was able to do my own fusion extensions without an issue! I'm thrilled with my purchase, and this beauty heats up quickly and consistently, as well as being easy to clean excess glue once it cools off. I'm VERY happy with this product and highly recommend it for keratin bonding and fusion extensions. It's great for anyone with little experience (I've never done my own extensions before today and only had them done twice - once with an ultrasonic tool and once using an old flat iron for heat) and even pretty easy to do areas you can't see like the back of your head. Didn't burn myself once, which is downright impressive. I would totally recommend it if you're on the fence, there are youtube tutorials showing exactly how it's done.

I purchased this from another site (Modern Man UK) at a lower price. But about the product itself... fantastic. Absolutely wonderful. It has more of a "croap" type of texture, and very easily picks up on my badger brush, forming a dense, slick lather. I don't normally do as well on the first go, as every soap/cream has its quirks -- but this one performed brilliantly on my first try. Not only that, but I also decided to use this in combo with a brand new razor (an EJ) and a new blade (which can sometimes a bit rough on first use), both bad ideas when you're trying a new cream/soap for the first time. Too many adjustments. All those risks aside, the shave went PERFECTLY. Not a nick, weep or burn. Just a nice, clean shave and a fine smelling mug to show for it!

Be aware that the scent can seem a bit strong while in use, but it tones down very nicely after shaving -- which makes me really appreciate the care with which the manufacturer scents their products. As for the scent itself -- I took a while to really take to it, as again, it comes across a bit overpowering at first -- but it mellows into something unique -- all at once sweet, woodsy and spicy, but decidedly masculine -- if that makes any sense. I highly recommend this product.

I tried it for 1st time and loved how it turned out. Love raw twisted teal hair color.

I was really excited about getting this hair dye and using it but sadly it was a GIGANTIC disappointment 😭

1.) On the bottle, in the item description, etc it says that the color lasts for 45 washes but I can promise you that it does NOT last that long heck it barely even lasted 10% as long as it claims to (and yes that's even with me only washing my hair in cold water, only washing my hair once a week, using color protecting products, etc). Within only 4 washes the color has drastically faded and there's even some spots where the color has completely washed out already leaving bleach blonde patches. There's a few semi/demi hair dyes i've used that will still stay pretty even when fading but unfortunately this isn't one of them- it's not ugly per say but it's really bland, lifeless and has me wanting to rush to the store to buy some more hair dye so I can fix it ASAP. I never thought in a million years i'd ever find a semi/demi hair dye that was worse then Splat when it came to fading but man this dye takes the cake- with me taking care of my colored hair properly Splat will last me 10 washes before it gets to the "ew ugly it faded I need to do a touch up" stage whereas once again this only lasted 4 washes.

2.) This color isn't teal in fact it's more of a dark blue with teal highlights/shine that you can only see if you're outside or standing directly under a light inside. I bleached my hair beforehand getting it 100% bleach blonde because I wanted it to be as bright as possible and even with that it still came out dark (and even while fading it looks blue have yet to see any green). I can't speak for anyone else but a genuine teal color is the unicorn of hair dye in my world- i've been dying and cutting my own hair pretty much only using semi/demi hair dye for over 10 years now and in all that time I have yet to find a genuine teal color. I've pretty much tried every brand I could get my hands on with zero luck- it's either dark blue with teal highlights/shine like this one, 98% green with 2% blue, green, dark green, blue, etc. I know going to a salon is an option and is probably my best bet to get genuine teal but because of my failings for the last decade i'm terrified of spending a couple hundred dollars just to end up with a non teal color again 😣. What in the world is going on? 🤣 It's not the olden days where getting colors is impossible and we had to make our own colors using rare to find items it's 2022 so surely there's a way to get a GENUINE TEAL hair dye!

3.) I can't speak for anyone else but in my experience this is hands down the thickest hair dye i've ever come across. This wouldn't of been an issue for me had the bottle design been the same as a lot of other semi/demi hair dyes are (a short easily accessible resealable cylinder) but since it wasn't and instead was put into a thick, dark and non flexible bottle it was next to impossible to get all the dye out or even see how much was in there. To get it out you either have to mix in some really watery hair conditioner or cut the bottle open and hope you don't hurt yourself or get dye all over the place in the process. While the design is visually really cute it's not practical- you end up wasting a lot of dye because you can't get it all out, in an attempt to get the remaining dye out you have to risk injuring yourself or getting dye all over the place or diluting it, since the bottle is black you have no idea how much dye is in there when you first get it so you won't know if you've been ripped off or not after getting a lot out you'll have no idea how much is still in there, because the dye is so thick and it's badly designed you end up having to constantly hit the bottom of the bottle/squeeze on it really hard/shake it hard etc just to get it out which after 20+ minutes really hurt my hands, you can't use the dye right out of the container like you can with the other cylinder hair dye containers and finally because you can't store any left over dye- the opening is so darn tiny there's no way you'll be able to get this thick dye back inside to use later on.

4.) This cost me $12.99 plus tax per bottle (it took 4 bottles to do my hair because I have really long thick hair) and when I bought it the price didn't bother me in fact it's pretty much average as far as semi/demi hair dye goes (the cheapest hair dye I use costs $10 a piece and the most expensive I use is $15 a piece so this is right in the middle) but after taking into account that it's not a genuine teal color, how insanely quickly it fades, how unpractical the design is, that I can't store unused dye, how much ends up going to waste and all the other negatives the price is definitely not worth it to me.

5.) If you've used semi/demi hair dye as much as I have then you already know about the notorious staining and bleeding that comes with these types of hair dyes haha but FYI this one is worse then what you're used to. With every other semi/demi hair dye i've used by the second wash the bleeding stops, the staining on my skin and ears has gone away, it doesn't stain my skin and ears while wet, scratching my scalp doesn't result in stained fingers and dye under my nails and my fingers won't get stained while I wash my hair but with this dye all those negatives have continued all the way past the 4th wash. Basically this dye has all the negatives of semi/demi hair dye but NONE of the positives 🤷🏻‍♀️

So all in all I really don't like this hair dye and wouldn't recommend it. Tbh the only thing it has going for it is that it does make my hair feel really soft and doesn't leave a weird coating on my hair like some other semi/demi hair dyes do but that doesn't mean much when everything else was a fail. Now that I think about it though I think this dye would be perfect for people who either only want crazy colored hair for a short period of time (like for a halloween costume, cosplay, an event, etc) or for parents whose kid's want to dye their hair a crazy color because it fades really quickly and isn't bright at all and is pretty mellow for semi/demi dye, as for vets like me who actually want long lasting bright color STAY AWAY 🙏🏼😂

As a curly girl, I'm very familiar with using hair oils. This one is an organic blend of argan oil and shea butter. Both are excellent for hair. You can use this as a shine booster, hot oil treatment, or anything else you choose. You could even try it as an overnight treatment. It's a great product. I highly recommend it.

Thanks so much for taking the time to read this review. I hope the information that I've provided makes your decision a little easier.

I gave this to my daughter, who is going to be extra careful due to the broken top. If it goes on the side, it is going to leak and that was before I unwrapped the package. My daughter loves argan oil so she is going to use it rather than me throw it away.

This argan oil and shea butter serum works pretty well. I use it on really dry days. When it is dry and cold my hair is crazy. It sticks out every which way and is impossible to make it lay flat or be reasonable. This stuff helps calm it down. It makes it actually lay down and gives it a smooth look. It does take some practice at applying it. If I get distracted it is easy to put too much and make my hair look oily. I have used product like this in the past that come in spray bottles or pump bottles and that made it easier to get just what I needed. This bottle has an eye dropper type applicator. I am not a fan of this. I use it to drop some into the palm of my hand and then rub it between my hands and carefully apply it to my hair starting in the back on the most underneath layer that way the front and the top layer do not get too oily. After applying it I gently brush my hair to work it through completely. I regularly put way too much in my hands and wash it off so I don't over do it.

Had actually been looking at a competing retailer that had 1 pair for a higher price for the Wonderwin arch supports. Stumbled on this retailer and I am glad I did. These fit snugly and the arch supports themselves are broad; they actually have a large coverage area. I have a very high arch and most arch supports barely have any affect. By themselves (walking around with only these on), I can barely feel the actual arch support itself. However, the silicone gel band gives a good snug support without being uncomfortable. They are easily stretched before putting them on and then they slowly begin to tighten to a good snug fit. You do have to be careful putting on socks over these as they have a tendency to roll up as you pull your socks on. Once you put on your shoes, the actual arch support comes into play. Because it covers a large area of your arch, they do not get tiring like some of the small area gel inserts that are not much bigger than a half dollar.  I recently developed PF in my left foot and needed some new shoes. Even with shoes that claimed they were for high arches, I still need more support and these fit the bill. I just got these today, and I am already feeling a difference in both of my feet. They are soft but very supportive. I am very glad I bought these.

At first I thought I made a mistake buying this. There was a learning curve, for me, and this is how I made it work:

1. I suggest using a candle, I use a votive. This gives me full control of the melt so I can focus on the stick and application. I could not manage to do this with a lighter. BE CAREFUL until you learn what the wax looks like at a safe temperature. Blowing on the wax fixes an overheat easily.

2. This was my first time using a wax of this nature, so I came to find I needed a much thicker layer to ensure full removal the first go. I have thick dark hair so you may get away with less, play around with it. My application looks like a multicolored, gloppy mess when it is ready to remove because I need time to build and spread it properly.

3. I use the stick for removal. I pull my skin taught, touch the tip of the wax stick to the edge of my application and pull. You can feel when it grips. I do not lift the stick up away from my skin at all. I keep it close and pull against the hair growth. This ensures I won't have to go over the same spot again.

I have sensitive skin and this is the first wax where the redness leaves my face. Before I would have to make sure to wax in the evening, apply something like Neosporin, and hope the redness was gone by the morning. It would always linger somewhere so I used my concealer on already irritated inflamed skin. Ouch! Tweezing and epilating would break me out around my lip area, removal creams had the same effect as waxing but I had to use it more often, and I couldn't use the buff paper because, again, sensitive skin. Would I appreciate if this was a little more forgiving on technique, yes! I am not the most patient or skilled person. Avoiding the aftermath, however, makes it worth it for me.

First natural deodorant containing baking soda that does not make my underarms burn. Faint pleasant scent. I've tried many natural deodorants in my quest to perspire but not stink, and this is the first one I'll be repurchasing. Very pleased with this product.

This is the best natural deodorant I've used to date. I've used Jason, Kiss My Face, Bali Secrets - and lots others I can't remember. This one does the best job. I don't get smelly at all after a full day of wear. If you've used natural deodorants before, you know that with most others you have to reapply or wash and reapply to stay BO-less all day.

The only con to this product it that it is relatively hard to apply. It's not a smooth gel or cream, but rather a hard-ish bar that you apply slowly so your body heat warms the product to spread on. There's also a bit of technique that I've found to work best to eliminate clumping - if you swipe slowly downwards first (top to bottom) then back up, you can pick up most of the clumps that happened with your first swipe.

The scent is fantastic with this product as well - it's light and fresh smelling. Not floral or unnatural at all. I love it.
I have tried many. This product really works. Help a with wetness and odor.

This deodorant is awesome! I've used so many different deodorants/anti perspirants throughout my life (Ban, Dove, Secret... clinical strength, you name it) and they work at first, but after a while (not even a full stick) I find myself sweating tons and smelling bad. I thought there was something wrong with me! My mom and sister have switched to natural deodorants, and I kept telling them there was no way some eco-friendly deodorant would work if the highest level of chemical-bomb anti perspirant didn't work for me. Anyway, after nothing working and my mom and sister telling me how much I was poisoning my pits, I decided to try going natural. So glad I did! It was a bit weird getting used to the thickness, but if you apply slowly as directed, it melts on your body. The lavender mint smell is light and refreshing, even for someone who doesn't really like lavender or mint smells by themselves. I've gone through a few sticks of this (my one complaint is that the size is so small, I'm ordering a new one every few weeks) and it still works great! Another added perk is after a few weeks the unsightly razor bumps and ingrown hairs I've been living with for years on my armpits are completely gone! After a few weeks of using this, I noticed my pits were slightly darker and a little crusty, so I exfoliated (probably a bit too roughly) and the skin under was raw and sensitive. I thought I was having a bad reaction, but a few days later I noticed my armpits were completely smooth and my normal skin color. My pits must have had years and years of built up skin and scarring for shaving that this deodorant was somehow able to get rid of! I haven't had that weird darkness or crustiness since (I would recommend exfoliating every week or so, though).

Bottom line, if you want to try natural deodorants but sweat and smell a lot, this should work great. Also if you struggle with redness and bumps from shaving, this can help with that too! This razor seemed to have a lot of promise but failed to make it. First off there are a few good points. The rest;
The head is way too big, nearly impossible to get hairs in area around nostrils.
The head does not hold the blade edge properly and causes flex/chatter.
The blade edge reveal seems incorrect. The blade edge seems too even with the comb so that when you adjust the razor you just get a wider gap that lets skin in but not more edge reveal. Just ends up harder to dial in a comfortable shave.
The head moves around too much causing uneven gap that you constantly have to correct.
Balance of the razor is terrible.

The included blades are acceptable, on par with your average blade but nothing I would purchase.

I finally found for myself the sweet spot for a close and smooth shave is slightly past the number three on the adjustment dial. In conclusion, I am happy with the razor for the price and will never use any other type of razor as long as the double edge razor exists.

The so-called "wireless" charging consists of a base you plug into a USB adapter (not supplied) which has 4 metal contacts on the top. First, I want to say that I am not a professional nail tech. I bought this because I am trying to manage my own nails during this pandemic. I started with another battery operated drill set but I felt it didn't meet my needs because there was no emery board drill bit and I couldn't adjust the speed. This set has everything you see in a professional nail salon. You get the full spectrum of drills, with emery board bits. There is a quick start guide that tells you what each drill bit is used for (although it doesn't explain what the white drill bit is for and I still haven't figured it out). The cord is just long enough for my needs but it would be better if it were six inches to a foot longer. It has adjustable speed settings.

My only complaint is that if you are using this for your own nails, the on/off switch and the speed wheel is further down on the cord instead of being on the drill itself. I found myself fumbling at times turn it off while half of my fingers are wrapped in cotton balls to soak off nail dip. This wouldn't be an issue for anyone using the tool to do nails on other people. It is just a minor but annoying drawback for those of us who are using the tool to do our own nails. All in all this is a really great product that has stood up to me dropping it several times and it is priced similar to much less sturdy drill sets and drill sets with fewer features. I would definitely recommend this to others.

Since learning how to do poly gel on my own, I am doing my nails & my friends’ nails all the time. This drill makes taking off the nails a breeze. Also sanding and cleaning is much easier. Very small, light and easy to control.Great product!

I’ve tried several different Karuna masks...they’re all good, but some are better than others.  This particular set is a great mix of masks designed to help with different needs, including hydrating, soothing and brightening.  The masks are individually wrapped and presented in a box that opens like a book, with suggestions for which masks to use on which days.  The packaging is nice and these would make a great gift.  The masks are very saturated (overly saturated, IMO) with serum, with plenty left over to use on my neck.  They’re large enough to easily cover my entire face, and come with a paper backing that makes them easy to to unfold.  Because they’re so saturated they easily slip while on my face, which makes it impossible to do anything other than sit still for the 20-30 minutes I wear them.  Also, there’s so much serum left on my face after I remove the masks, it’s impossible for my skin to absorb it all.  I’ve discovered that lightly splashing my face with cold water helps remove the excess serum and my skin fully dries more quickly.  Ultimately, all of the face masks left my skin very soft and hydrated, and a few of them plumped my skin and created a lovely even skin tone.  There is one set of eye masks in the kit and that that were surprisingly light and effective, reducing puffiness and brightening my eyes.  These are a tiny bit pricey, but they’re a nice quality and I like having a set of masks that cover a range of needs.

Overall the Karuna 7 Days of Glow mask set has some good masks that do as they say without irritation. While I don't use face masks every day, it has taken me a while to use just a few of them, and specific masks, like the hydration mask, aren't best suited for my face type. Out of the whole set, my favorite masks have been the brightening and antioxidant masks. While I was slightly hesitant to use the antioxidant mask at first due to my oily combo skin, it left me with no clogged pores or irritation, and it brightened and soothed my skin.

As I mentioned initially, I don't use face masks too often, and the masks I usually use are pretty cheap. Trying these masks has ruined me a little because it will be hard to go back to my regular masks. The one thing I don't like about these masks is the price. I think $42 is a little bit much for seven face masks, but it depends on how often you use face masks and how much of a splurge you want them to be. in terms of quality, I think the Karuna masks are great.

This set is perfect for someone who wants a little of everything. Each of the mask are individually wrapped. Each of the mask included in the kit has a different purpose. Compared to lots of different mask brands I've tried there is more than enough fluid and juices in these mask with additional fluid you can spread on after. This is a great item for a gift or to even have a spa night with friends. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS.

This is a really great sheet mask pack. It hits all your skincare needs. These are the cloth style masks which I always find have more serum, better sticking power and a better fit than the hydrogel masks.

The eye patches I especially liked. They're packed full of serum, stay on well and cover the whole under eye and side area. The brightening face mask did seem to make my skin more even and brighter but it does say not for sensitive skin. I do sometimes have some sensitivity issues but didn't experience that with any of the masks.

There's enough serum in all the masks that you can use the excess the next day as a serum or swipe over your décolletage. I like to keep my masks in the fridge. They feel great when they're chilled. This is definitely a product I'll be buying again.
These masks make my skin so soft and hydrated! I really like the idea of a variety pack. I am defintely purchasing again.

The Exfoliating... well I really enjoyed the hydrating!

Just had my first shave with this. I've used two electric razors in my life. One was an already ancient one that my dad had, about 40 years ago. Ripped each of the few hairs in my face out one by one. Then an early Norelco 3-head circular job, about 30 years ago that either sucked or I didn't know how to use. Very even stubble was the result of that. Hence my refusal to try one until my memories have faded.

This review reflects one shave - not a long term review.

I'm impressed. It's slower than I expected, I half-thought I could activate an app on my phone or something and I would be shaved (I'm joking!). It's pretty darn close to a manual 5-blade fresh razor.

Here are the conditions under which I'm reporting:
- I'm 62, so my skin isn't exactly taut on my face.
- Not a heavy beard, I need to shave every day now, but not until I was about 35.
- This shave was with 2 days of stubble.
- I usually shave in the shower, using Braille to tell when a patch is smooth.

I used the razor dry. The manual said to charge the razor before first use, but it came out of the box showing 100% charge so I went for it. The manual also says not to apply too much pressure, so I was tentative at first. It helps to apply fair pressure while moving the razor SLOWLY through that fungus that seems to grow constantly on our faces.

Stretching my skin with other-handed fingers in most spots helped. I used a mirror just to watch the progress, but you can use your sonic sensors, AKA ears, to tell when the blades are and aren't removing stubble. I don't think a mirror is at all necessary, YMMV.

While I've been writing this, I've used Braille again to check on the usual trouble spots - I can just grab the mower and run it over the rough bits while I'm doing this. You could do this easily while driving somewhere - no risk of a small knick, and the aural attention that it takes doesn't really distract from driving.

I didn't notice when I ordered this razor that it came with an extra foil. Nice detail, since the foil is easy to damage being thin (as it should be). The kit comes with a carrying bag, which is nice to keep everything together while traveling. I would find a small rigid container for the extra foil if I were to travel with that - it could easily get bent in the carrying bag knocking around with all the bits. The foil is too long for the old canisters from film cameras, but a cut-off from a roll of Xmas paper would suffice.

The grip is comfortable and makes the shaving head easy to maneuver. The carrying bag contains everything in a small package - I'm a Cardinal (Archbishops and above don't shave) in the Church of Small Luggage and I will happily carry this instead of a couple of manual razors on any trip.

Finally (applause erupts from the crowd), very nearly close shave as a manual razor, a little slower than a manual razor, works very well dry (absolutely unlike a manual razor, though I've tried that also and it does sort of work).

Buy it. Try it.

I love the smell of an old fashioned barbershop, and this pomade captures the scent really well. The Ace High holds my hair really well, and doesn't leave it feeling greasy or slick after applying. A little bit goes a long way too, so this tub will last quite awhile. And it washes off very quickly and cleanly too.

When I first opened the jar, I groaned a little. Judging by the consistency of the product, I thought it was going to be more of a styling cream, than a conventional pomade. It felt too loose and watery.

I'm not really sure how, but this stuff changes dramatically when you apply it your hair. It firms right up and makes it very easy to put your hair in place and hold it there.

When it drys, it holds well. It's not as stiff as hair gel and has a little bit of flex, but it should hold up well, unless it's very, very windy outside.

A little bit goes a long way. I don't doubt that this jar will last a few months. Then again, I don't have a lot of hair.

There is not much of a scent and once it's applied, you won't notice it at all.

I'd say this is the best pomade I've found and even beats out American Crew in terms of quality and value.
Love this stuff. Once I figured out how much to use, since it is more like a cream than a wax, it’s been fantastic. Smells like that classic barber shop smell. I’ll certainly buy this again.

First impression is that the smell is mainly eucalyptus based, but not too strong. The texture out of the can is at first very creamy, which I thought may affect the holding power, but once I worked in a couple of fingertip sized scoops into my hair, I found that the pomade started to take hold and firm up. My hair held its shape throughout the day and was easy to fix with a comb if needed. When washing it out, despite containing oils and wax, regular shampoo seemed to do the trick. Little to no residue leftover in my hair after a shower.

This product has everything I like. A likeable backstory about the founders, produced in small hand crafted patches, and delivers the quality results that it promises.

I wear my hair short (buzzed on the sides) with about 3-4 inches on top, which I style differently depending on the day. I usually like it combed to the side, and pushed back, but with volume to give it a nice swoop. My hair is fine, but a lot of it.

I’ve never been a fan of pomade in the past because I find it doesn’t hold it’s shape and is too shiny. However, this pomade provides a natural looking shine, while holding my hair in my preferred style. The pomade itself is very light and thin. I didn’t think it would work when applying, but within seconds it began to form my hair into my go-to style. It dries to a “tacky” feel, which allows you to readjust throughout the day, but wouldn’t feel comfortable to run your fingers through it. After applying, the product easily washed off my hands, and out of my hair at the end of the day.

The scent is good but not overwhelming. It has the typical “masculine” scent that you will find in deodorants, body wash, shaving cream, etc. for men. The scent lingers till you wash it out.

Overall, I will definitely be using up this entire jar.

I purchased this item as, despite the cleaning and scrubbing, I occasionally get blemishes. Surprise right? While poking and prodding squeezing my face until bruised at times, I knew there had to be a better way. I did a little bit of reading and found that many professionals use tools such as this to keep the blemishes under control and "extract" the blemishes. I decided that I would give it a try and purchase this kit to see how well these tools work. It came in the mail yesterday and so far, I am impressed. It was nicely packaged in a cellophane bag and the nice case which contains all of the tools. After trying to familiarize myself with the tools, I went to work. The tools work well, but I do wish that they had come with instructions. Some of them are self explanatory, but it would be nice to know what tool works best fro which application. Immediately after "working" I did notice that the area was a bit red, but this dissipated leaving no bruising and a cleaner complexion. So in practice, I like this kit, but do wish that it came with instructions. I can see uses for this set beyond blemish extraction, but those uses are beyond the scope of this review.
In full disclosure, I did receive this product at a discount in exchange for an honest review. I take this process seriously and only chose to review those items for which my family or I have a real use. I hope you have found this review helpful, as I aim to guide others in wisely spending their hard earned money.
Great kit! Always wanted to try this out and works great with blackheads around nose area. Comes in a zip around case holder to keep organized!

This kit is very useful for blackheads, whiteheads, and visibly clogged pores. I like it especially for the nose because it's much more gentle and effective than just plain squeezing. I also like that in comes in a small convenient case. The only thing I would have liked with this kit is a diagram that would explain which tool is best for what, but trial and error and I'm figuring it out. Also, this is not made for cystic acne (at least from what I've tried). I like it for what it's good for which is mainly blackheads. So if that's what you're looking for this will do the trick.

My wife ordered this kit so that we could use them on each other. Mostly so she could use them on my. She like to help me with my black head problem. Most of mine are on my nose and cheek areas. Previous to this kit she would use her finger nails and a large needle. We started doing some research and realized that not only where her finger nails not very effective they were damaging skin all around the black head.

The tools arrive and she can not wait to give them a try. The are very effective at getting out black head that she would not have been able to do other wise. In one sitting she was able to clean out more black heads then she would normally have been able to do in 3 or more. The tools are strong and sturdy. They do not bend and are easy to grip. The only draw back to this kit is the fact that no instruction are included. The solution for this is that my wife watched many youTube videos. The showed her how to use the different tools on different areas of the face. They also mentioned several point on the need to sanitize the tools before and after use. And gave tips on how to do it.

I would recommend this kit to others. It worked very well and i expect it will last.

I can put it on a few minutes before bed, and not worry about getting oil or lotion all over the sheets. I’ve been using it mostly on my legs and arms, but also made a point to use it on my hands and cuticles, and my hands felt great. I think it will be really good this winter as the air gets drier.

I did not, however, like this in my hair. Oils usually work really well in my hair, but I felt like the scent changed almost immediately after putting it on. I smelled a rancid smell, which it does not have in the bottle, and my hair and scalp were clean. Perhaps it’s just my body chemistry, but I was not a fan of this use.

A couple of other things that I wanted to mention that I think are important to know before you buy this:

1. Peppermint and Eucalyptus Essential oils are not recommended on children under the age of six and 10 respectively, so I would not use this on babies or toddlers despite the recommendation on the insert. Children under the age of two should generally avoid topical use of any essential oil. Yes, the oils in this product appear to be highly diluted, but I wouldn’t chance it. They are still smelling it even if you’re not putting it on them.

2. I’m hesitant to use anything with essential oils as an “intimate” lubricant as recommended. Too much potential (in my mind) for mucosal membrane damage, and no, I’m not talking about your nose. Also, oil-based lubricants will break down latex, so be aware of this.

Other than the above concerns I mentioned (which are not concerns if you are using it correctly) I really like using this moisturizer. I will definitely continue to enjoy it.

Halfway through this bottle of Ruth Paul Full Body Oil Moisturizing Oil and had to share my thoughts.  When I first got it, it sprayed a lovely fine mist but as I used it more, the spray didn't work as well.  Not a deal breaker, it's an oil blend, won't always spray perfect but I was bummed.  Also, wasn't sure what a "dry oil" meant but as I used it, I realized that it must mean less greasy finish, which it is.  I rub from head to toe and can almost immediately put my clothes on.  I have some scratches on my arms and this oil has helped them heal, and since using, almost completely gone.  A sign of a good healthy oil.  I have very dry over-flat-ironed hair, and after rubbing on my arms, I run my hands through my hair.  LOVE it on my hair.  I have put on my hair a couple days in a row, before washing, and never felt greasy.  You just have to adjust the amount to how dry your hair is.  The buds in it are a very nice touch, but not sure if they had an effect on the spray, maybe blocking it?  When the spray went flat, I opened the bottle to release the pressure, and tightly capped it again.  Helped a little.  Now I just spray it into my hands rub it in by hand.  All in all, this moisturizing oil is amazing and delivers what is advertised.  I love that it can literally be used head-to-toe, I rub on my toes, body, and end with my hair.

I saw several reviews where people said the bottle leaked. Well, they were right.  The top was on snug, but the oil still seems to seep out. This may be due to poor design of pump. The pic attached shows the box was soaked with the oil. I will be sure to store it with a small piece of plastic under the bottle so as to not ruin my travertine tile counter or the wood cabinet drawers in my bathroom. Can't give a review of the product itself as I just received it today and put a little on my arms and elbows. It does smell (Eucalyptus) nice though, but the scent dissipates rather quickly.

This oil has a great peppermint scent, a light feel, and absorbs quickly into my skin.  I use it for many things, although I have a few favorites.  I rub it into my damp hands a couple of times a day which leaves them softer and, unlike usual, my cuticles are not cracked or split (see photo 1).  I spray four or five pumps into my hand, rub them together and run them through my towel-dried hair.  Then I leave it to air dry and it ends up curly and soft (see photo 2) and lasts a couple of days until I wash it again.  I absolutely love the versatility.
The oil does a magic for hair and skin. I have told my friends to get this, and I highly recommend it.
The oil does a magic for hair and skin. I have told my friends to get this, and I highly recommend it.

Needless to say i have xp with hair removal. I was never really a super hairy but loved the feeling of being totally hairless from head to toe.

With all the sessions and hrs i barley have any hair but do have some spots on thighs, arms and other spots, that are fairly light even with all the professional laser treatments and electrolysis. IPL aka this device is NOT the go-to treatment for hair reduction but it does work.

Firstly, you need to use an electric razor or standard razor on the areas your zapping. Freshly showered, no oils or lotions on skin. If you dont feel heat your not killing hair follicles. The laser targets the pigment in the hair and absorbs the heat, so as they stated vampire skin, dark hair gets the best results.

If you have never gotten any sort of pro hair removal your hair is going to be fuller and courser. Like the subject heading states, ive had 28 full body laser hair removal treatments aka real hair removal that leaves you with red bumps, plus hrs of electrolysis and I still have hair grow back.

People it takes a long time to remove hair! This is not designed to be a one zap and the hair is gone. It will grow back finer and weaker, until it eventually is killed off. It literally takes years.

I zap each spot 5 times on the highest setting. The heat will build on each subsequent zap, meaning im actually hitting follicles. I would not recommend this if you have course hair or never had pro hair removal - build up to that, but this device is a nice supplement to the pro hair removal. It will never replace it and will take longer. For me its perfect and thats why i gave it 5 stars.

Once you zap the hair you should see a reaction, raised bumps, some redness, along the bikini line for example its very noticeable since the hair is courser - that means its working. It takes about 10 -14 days for the zapped hair to push its way out. Its not instant, the hair still remains in the follicle. You can expedite this by lightly exfoliating in the bath or shower. You may see little black spots in the follicle where the hair has been zapped and effectively targeted.

Hair grows in cycles, doing this every week is pointless, if the hair is not in the growth phase you cant kill it. Every 4 weeks, multiple zaps per spot and the hair WILL fall out and come back weaker. Different areas have different growth cycles but 4 weeks is a good middle ground.

This is used for hair reduction. If you want permanent (still takes multiple treatments( you need electrolysis.

If you want faster hair reduction result you need to use laser only found at the dermatologist or reputable laser spa. IPL is not laser treatment. This is not going to ever replace that. A combination of all three over 3 or 4 years will leave you hairless, so keep your expectations realistic.

Was happy to locate this razor for my husband; it's like his old one that finally died and they don't make them anymore, but luckily I was able to locate this one thru Amazon. Thanks guys!

My wife got me this razor at the store that she works at so we got a better price because of her employee discount as a Christmas gift.
I have been a wet and shaving cream shaver man since I was a teenager only using the best razors such as the Mach disposables blades and I would up grade every time a new and better product came out.
This being said I did not like electric razors or believed in them, nothing like a new clean sharp blade right?
Well as you fellows know you can not hurt the wife's feelings especially when it comes to a christmas gift.
Enter the Phillips Norelco Reflex Plus 6423 LC. I plugged him in a gave it a try and I had was in a completely different world of shaving, I had a much better closer more comfortable shave than I have ever experienced before without the skin irritation and accidental nicks and cuts that come with top of the line blades.
I can shave without a mirror and anywhere there is a electrical outlet and if I am running late for work in the morning I just hurry and plug it in and mow it over my face for about 30 seconds and I am out the door and still get a close shave without all the mess and water.
Results with this razor are excellent.
1- Clean close comfortable shave.
2- Convenient no mess shave.
3- less expensive than disposible blades yet with a better shave.
In closing after almost 30 years of using disposable blades I will never go back to them and I have had this little tropper for about 4 years without replacing new blades for it and I still get a really comfortable clean shave I just give it a good cleaning once a month.
This Norelco is a very good shaving system and it is not just the electric razor method itself because I have tried other electric shavers along with this one and they did not in anyway compare to the results that I get from the Reflex Plus.
Bravo Norelco and thank you for a excellent product.

Mike

I agree with a prior reviewer, It won't keep running unless you cement the plug to the razor with silicon rubber.  The female plug is just too small for the hole in the razor and just falls off.  The coiled wire provided is too short.

Norelco 6423LC Reflex Plus Corded Men's Shaving System
Very nice shaver. My husband liked it but has passed away now. I gave it to my son and he likes it also.

I've been using this Norelco 6423 Reflex Plus corded electric razor for about 2 1/2 weeks now, and so far, I'm glad I decided to buy it.

My old Panasonic rechargeable razor didn't seem to be holding a charge for very long anymore, plus it was time to replace the foil and cutting heads again. For about the same amount I would have spent to replace the worn parts on my old razor (not even including the cost of replacing the battery), I got a brand new Norelco razor!

The first thing I noticed about the Norelco is that it's MUCH quieter than my old Panasonic. My Panasonic sounded like a Dustbuster when it was on. Another plus to the Norelco is that it does a much better job of shaving underneath my jaw line and on my neck. I have not had any problem with the cord coming out of the razor while shaving. It fits in there nice and snug. I also have had no problem with the razor grabbing my skin. Just make sure you don't press down too hard on your skin while shaving, and use your free hand to pull your skin tight while shaving your neck, as suggested in the accompanying booklet.

If you don't need a fancy, expensive razor that cleans itself or is rechargeable, give this one a try.

I've used this for over a year now, so it seems fair to review it.

It does not shave as close as a blade, but no one expects it to.
It does not seem as fast on multiday growth as the non-rotary
shaver I used 40 years ago, but it seems as fast when used daily.
(Memories of 40 years ago are not reliable.)

It does a good job of keeping the waste inside. Instead of the
recommended cleaning every two weeks, I just remove the head
every weekend and tap the head and body against the sink a few
times.

As other reviewers noted, the cord is tightly coiled and stiff.
Every few months it pulls free from the shaver enough to remove
power, but not enough to fall off. This inconvenience adds several
seconds to my shave time.

If it was lost, I'd probably replace it with the same model.

Added, January 2008: Late last year I finally noticed the shave was
not as close as it had been, and it took longer. Time to replace
the head. Norelco recommends every year; I can confirm that two years
is too long. Replacing the entire thing was less than $3.00 more than
replacing just the head, so I really have bought it again.

a good shave at a reansonable price

I really like the idea behind this and I thought, since my hair is a little damaged it would be a good product for me however, after using it just one time I feel like my hair was a little greasy after getting out of the shower. I did use it with some Moroccan oil and that may have been the reason it felt greasy. The next time I try this, I think I’m going to use just the shampoo and the other bottle and see how it does. I really do like the scent though. It’s a little bit citrusy and very light. The other bottle of stuff has a slightly spicy scent to it but it’s not overpowering. I will say that there were no English directions included with this, so I had to end up going online to find out whether or not I was supposed to wash out the other bottle and you are in fact, supposed to rinse it out after you put it in and let it sit for six seconds. Neither of these felt particularly oily to me, so I was a little disappointed with how greasy my hair felt after I dried it. I’m not sure if you’re using a blow dryer made a difference or not. Usually I let my hair dry but I was anxious to see the results. after I’ve used it a few more times I’ll update my review one way or the other as to whether I like it or whether it’s making my hair greasy.

The shampoo has oil in it to help your dry/damaged hair quickly recovers. Certainly oily shampoo than normal but the oil is really helping reduce the dryness of the hair which is the reason the hair is prone to split and damage. The ampoule is easy to use, use after shampooing and just massage it in for about a min before rinsing off. I wish there is an English manual to help explaining the instruction because the box and bottles only have Korean instructions.

This product smells nice and feels good in my hair, I'm not sure about long term use but I do like it. If you're looking into asian hair care products this was a great place to start for me and it seems on par with other salon quality products.
The shampoo was good, lathered very nicely and smelled great.  But the conditioner- that was amazing.  Highly recommended!

Thankfully, there are English directions on the listing because there aren’t any on the bottles or packaging. Either way, I love this shampoo! It’s not something I use daily, but once or twice a week keeps my hair from drying out so much. I have fine, naturally curly hair that I dry with a diffuser several times a week. The heat leaves my hair dry. This oil shampoo smells like peaches to me, lathers well and washes out cleanly leaving me with soft, shiny, curls.  It’s too heavy for me for daily use, but as a moisturizing treatment, it’s wonderful! My hair really does look better when I use it, but after it’s almost too soft to style. I usually make it part of my Saturday wash routine and once more during the week if needed.  The ampoule is an excellent for de tangling, and it actually helps with the seborrheic dermatitis I get around my hairline that flakes and itches. If your hair is dry or damaged, this is a great repair treatment that I definitely recommend!

My wife straightens and curls quite a bit, almost daily, so her long hair tends to get very damaged from heat. We both tried out this damaged hair care set and while I didn't notice much difference for myself, my wife reports that her hair is in much better shape now.

Based on feedback from a Sonicare customer service rep, I recently replaced it with the more basic Sonicare Essence e5500 model; but it was big, clunky and noisy, so I returned it. Perfect for my 24in long thick, coarse, tangled, color treated wavy-curly hair. I HATE brushing my hair. I’m 39 and worse than my 10year old niece when it comes to brushing hair. I recently developed dry scalp and hair breakage due to cold Minnesota weather and I was told this style of brush with regular brushing would help. But many reviews of other prices similar to this for hair similar to mine said the brushes we bad for detaingling. I had no issues with this brush. In fact this brush detangles better than any other brush I’ve owned including a brush that was combo boars hair with the nylon bristles and advertised for thick hair. My hair was not static afterwards like the other brush leaves it, my hair does create breakage like the other brush does, and it was immediately softer and shinier.

For those that are looking for a hairbrush and not a beard brush, this is a little on the small side. But that doesn’t make a difference and the size is not ineffective for my thick hair. This was another pleasant surprise given the massive amount of hair I have. I did know I was buying a beard brush so I knew it would be somewhat smaller. And truthfully, I didn’t read the full product description to know the exact size I was purchasing so that was my fault. I am definitely not displeased though. It is also a cheaper price than other brushes so the price plus small size means that I will can but a second one to put in my travel bag!

The other feature that I really like is that it does not have that rubber face that other brushes use to embed the bristles. I like that this face is entirely wood because I feel like water will not collect underneath when cleaning it potentially making it moldy. It also makes the bristles appear more firmly attached which hopefully will create less Bristle loss in the long run.
