I purchased this to take on a climb on Mt. Hood. It was my first technical climb, and my first time using any device of this type. I was able to practice a couple of times before the climb, but on the climb was the first time I had used it outdoors and in a place where I would be unable to clean up if things went wrong. I used it 3-4 times on the 13 hour climb, and it was successful each time. Given that there were men climbing ahead, behind, and with me, and because of the frigid temperatures, I was grateful not to have to disrobe to pee, and I didn't have any problems with dripping. I followed the instructions to scrape off when finished, and was able to clean the device somewhat in the snow afterward. I kept it in a zippered pouch made of recycled plastic, which kept it clean and away from my other things.

I was pleased with this device. It is a little awkward, but it certainly does the job.

I bought this out of sheer frustration after a particularly horrendous camping trip that involved me getting up in the middle of the night to pee and our dog pushing past me to tear out of the tent and chase a raccoon. We woke up half the camp and it was so embarrassing that I swore I was going to figure out a solution. I got this, and practiced in the shower like they said, but it worked great from the get-go. It does feel weird after a lifetime of conditioning to pee standing up wearing my jeans still pulled up, but I have never so much as gotten a drop on myself. I take it on all-day hikes, and use it overnight in my tent on camping trips with an old plastic bottle I've marked with a skull and crossbones. Get this! You won't regret it!

I wanted to give an update on this hair since I have now washed and conditioned it. I have not even had this hair for 2 weeks and I do not like it. I washed the hair once with a shampoo that contains no alcohol or sulfates and no other harsh chemicals. I also deep conditioned with Coconut Milk by OGX thinking that would help the dry ends of this hair. Well let me tell you it did not help. The ends are still dry and the hair is starting to shed at the ends more than what it did last week. I have only used heat on the hair twice and both times I used a non alcohol heat protectant. I condition this hair every two days with OGX weightless coconut oil and I braid it at night before bed. I use wide tooth comb and barely ever brush the hair. I usually just finger comb and I have lightly brushed the hair maybe 2-3 times since installing. I don't understand why the ends are so dry considering I have barely used heat and apply coconut oil to the ends of the hair every 2 days. I will not purchase this hair again because its just not very good quality and I would like my money back.

Update: as of 10/04/16. I have conditioner washed this hair again with OGX Coconut Milk and used OGX Hair Serum on the ends of the hair. The hair does okay after you wash it and let it air dry. The hair also holds a curl very well and looks refreshed after washing and conditioning. The ends of the hair don't look dry if you apply heat to the hair. However, constant heat will dry the hair out so I try not to apply much heat at all. The ends go back to being dry after a few days and I still have to constantly spray coconut oil to maintain the ends. The hair continues to shed but its not that bad, you just have to keep the hair moisturized and it won't shed that much.

It is often claimed that periorbital dark circles are caused by tiredness or working too hard or even just staying up late. While this can be true, the truth is that your genes play a huge role here. So what exactly is happening when you get dark circles under or around your eyes?

Simply put, periorbital dark circles are a result of the thin layer of skin below your eyes showing the blood vessels and the blood they contain more clearly than anywhere else on your body. (For reference, this skin around your eyelids, called periorbital skin, is on average about 0.5 mm thick compared to an average of about 2 mm thick on most of the rest of your body.)

Now, as you may or may not already know, the reason veins often look blue isn’t because the blood inside them is blue; it’s because your skin/subcutaneous tissue only lets blue/violet wavelengths of light pass through it. As a result, only blue light is reflected back and the veins look, well, bluish. (Veins often won’t appear blue if a person has darker or lighter skin. Rather, the veins tend to appear green or brown. On the other hand, people with extremely light skin, such as albinos, will typically have veins that show up as dark purple or dark red, more closely resembling the actual color of the blood running through the veins.)

It’s the exact same concept with the skin below your eyes. Those dark bluish circles are (usually) just the result of light being reflected back off of the blood vessels sitting just below the surface of that incredibly thin patch of skin. This is the same reason facial bruises are more prominent below or around the eyes; the thin skin just shows the blood from the ruptured blood vessels a little bit more clearly.

Again, as you may or may not know, as we age, our skin loses its elasticity and ability to regenerate and as a result, it becomes thinner. This is why more often than not, elderly people will have rather prominent periorbital dark circles regardless of how much they sleep. As with those who are genetically predisposed to having thinner skin below the eyes, it’s just biology.

Some products for treating calluses on the feet are too harsh (chemical sloughing lotion or gels) or too greasy (foot balms, creams). As a diabetic, it doesn't take long for calluses to form on the bottom of my feet--especially the heels, the sides, and the bottom of the toes. I soak my feet in a foot spa once a month with warm water and Epsom salt (any "spa" variety: tea tree, lavender, peppermint, menthol) and use a fine emery board to gently abrade the hard calluses. The Epsom salt is what makes the calluses to slough off, and the fine emery board helps speed the sloughing process.

In between soakings, I try to keep ahead of the stubborn callus growth by using the products mentioned above. Always looking for something "better" and a callus remover that wasn't prone to burn the delicate skin near the calluses, I found this: Major Pharmaceuticals' "Ammonium Lactate 12% Moisturizing Cream."

Ammonia lactate is a natural moisturizer of the skin. It's an acid, which is primarily the reason it works to get rid of accumulated dead, dry skin cells. So that the acid doesn't irritate the skin, the lactic acid is neutralized with ammonium hydroxide. The result is a cream that is deliberately neutralized to a comfortable, human-friendly pH of 4.5 to 5.5.

The key ingredient is ammonia lactate. It's the stuff that does away with dry, flaky skin, dead surface skin cells, and (what else but dead surface skin is calluses).

The cream doesn't just remove dead, dry skin cells, leaving your skin bare and raw, like some products do. To protect your skin, the cream contains a number of emollients to hydrate, soften, and exfoliate dry and rough skin.

Directions suggest applying the cream on dry skin twice a day. "Slow and steady wins the race!" the tortoise said to the hare. It's good advice in this instance. Harsh chemical sloughing lotions will quickly dissolve calluses, but it does so at the risk of burning and irritating proximal healthy skin. This cream works over a period of time that makes it safe for your skin. But in as little as three days, your feet will feel better, will look clearer, and seem softer.

I cannot really tell if it contributed to well health of my hair because I completely changed my entire hair care routine. In addition to this cap, I made a DIY hair masks, treatments, oils, and I am taking biotin liquid 10000 mcg, collagen peptides.
So, since that moment (August 2018), my hair is more beautiful, fuller, and my curls are well defines.

However, I really don't like the way this hair cap works. I don't feel the warmth.
It looks like the company changed the quality of the product. That is why the price has reduced. It is better to have a great quality product at the higher price than having a bad quality at cheap price.

PS: I am black, and I have natural kinky hair.

How do I use this cap?
1- After plugging it, I set to high setting. Leave it for 15min (following instructions); then put on head. I usually keep it on my head for between 30-45min (when doing prepoo, oils treatment,). I turn it off, then unplug.
2- I wash my hair (with my DIY shampoo), put either conditioner or hait mask. Then, I use again the cap (same process like on the 1st step, but keep the cap this time for grand max 20min).

If someone uses it differently and is satisfied of the results, please share your experience. It could be benefit for me as well.

Thanks

When I spotted the Mocmaki gel polish kit, several things caught my attention, the assembled color palettes to choose from and the number of polishes for the price.

The gel polish arrived packaged well. All gel polishes were tightly sealed, with no leaks, and came with application instructions. Disappointingly, these were the only positives factors. First, the bottles are made of cheap-feeling plastic, which surprised me. Second, the gel consistencies were just too thick, especially the glitter gels, note room temperature was a steady 72 degrees. Thus, I decided right then and there, the Mocmaki gel polishes were not for me.

There are a few honorable mentions however, all the colors were very vibrant and highly pigmented. The white and red applied the best, both brushed on smoothly and had a nice opaqueness after just one application, I still went ahead with a second coat, nonetheless.

Although not a professional nail tech, I do have over 6 years of DIY experience and have used many different gel polish brands throughout the years. The Mocmaki gels are by far my least favorite, but given the few bright spots mentioned, they earned at least 3 stars. Worth the price given the quantity, mmm sorry to say not so much.

I love this blend of essential oils for my face!  I use this product in the morning and at night and my face feels moisturized and healthy.  I really like knowing that I'm using an all natural product without all the "unknown" ingredients you get from other serums or creams.  I'm 46 and have fine lines that seem to be minimized by this product.  The smell is earthy which I don't and it  mind and soaks in quickly so you can apply makeup right away in the morning. What can I say that hasn't been said?  This is an exceptional blend.I have used the product for two weeks, and my skin does feel softer and looks healthier.  The pleasant fragrance is delicately floral. An excellent marriage of aromatherapy with skin care. The orange color dissipates immediately, and I find the color an asset.  Easy to see exactly how much is pumped.  It makes other "clear" products seem ordinary.  One drop is completely adequate to cover my face, neck and tops of hands.  There is no sticky or oily residue, and the serum absorbs quickly into the skin. No lengthy massage needed, which I have no patience for. I have no specific skin issues other than normal aging, so I can't speak to any corrective properties.  For me, this product works well as part of my daily skin care practice to maintain skin health.  The packaging is unique and elegant (although the written suggested use of 3-4 pumps is excessive). I thought the price might be too high, but testing the actual coverage from one pump, I believe this is a great value for money.  Highly recommend.

I've had my Glacier Floss for only a week, but am thoroughly impressed so far. I purchased it after yet another [[ASIN:B000063SLR WaterPik WP-60W Personal Dental Water Jet System]] broke (I've gone through several), and I was looking for an alternative to a countertop model. I looked at some of the other faucet-based oral irrigators (e.g., [[ASIN:B0028OV2S0 RediBreeze, Oral Irrigator]]), but decided on the Glacier Floss instead because of its magnet. I may write an update to this review after my dentist appointment, if he comments on any reduced plaque or tartar.

I like the lack of a reservoir - not having one makes it so easy to use, and more sanitary. Even though there is no pulsation, the pressure actually seems stronger than the WaterPik. I use it in conjunction with dental floss, and my teeth feel great afterwards.

The product was also easy to install, and there are no leaks so far. Finally, there is NO taste of recycled plastic from this product as another reviewer noted. I would definitely purchase it again.
Best thing for a clean mouth and no bad breath!

I was looking for an oral irrigator to clean the space between my gum line and the top of my bridge.  We have a small counter space in our bathroom so I  was looking for a simple device with lots of power.  Well, the Glacier Floss Dental Oral Irrigator fulfilled  both of those criteria.  It is a great little device, simple to install and efficient for flushing debris and flossing.  I would recommend this product without hesitation.

I've used one of these for several years now and really like it. It is so convenient.
Really helps get things that flossing might have missed.You should still floss also.
Man it was much cheaper on ebay when I bought mine. Dont see one for sale there now.

We love this product.  Your teeth feel like they were just cleaned by the dentist every night.  You don't have to worry about filling or cleaning the tank. I have given one to all my children, and grandchildren.  It's especially good for those with braces.

This is one of the few gadgety purchases I have made that is really worthwhile. I have sensitive teeth, and I love how you can adjust the water temp and pressure. I have 3 bridges and this really gets all the left behind bits out. My dentist was really pleased on my last visit, no 5's in the pressure test, mostly 2's and no 3's around my gums. I had no problems installing this, the instructions are clear standard American English.

I bought this item solely because I needed a portable oral irrigator, which allows me to use as much water as I need without refilling the water supply (which would normally be 3-4 times with my countertop unit)

I have been staying with family longer than anticipated, so I made the mistake of not bringing my countertop oral irrigator from home.

A wrench had to be used to loosen the faucet tip, where you attach the irrigator. Since I am at someone else's home, I can't keep asking them to produce a wrench each time I want to use it, and they won't allow me to keep the unit attached.

So, when I spent the night at a hotel, I took the device with me. I was hoping that every faucet tip is not as securely attached as the one at my in-laws. No such luck.

Every other hotel (I tested 3 so far) I have been to is the same. My husband travels with me, and even he could not loosen the faucet tips by hand. Unless you are willing to carry a wrench with you, this oral irrigator is not a good choice for portability.

As far as the function, it worked ok the one time I was able to use it. The pressure was so-so but I didn't really expect that much from a portable unit.

I had some trouble getting the temperature right. Every time I would switch back to faucet mode, the irrigator would run only cold water afterward, until I turned both spigots off, reopened them, then waited a few seconds. However, that may just be the particular faucet that I used.

In sum, I am unable to use this product. It's a shame that I cannot recommend it, as I had high hopes for it.
got 1st one 20 years ago and it is still working, bought this as a backup, has saved my gums and teeth.

I'm using this primarily to try to fill in my eyebrows, which have thinned out a lot over the last couple decades. I've used it once a day for 4 weeks, and am noticing a definite "for real" growth of eyebrows--even in places that were previously bare patches. This is one of the best non-aluminum deodorants that I've tried. Delivery was great, took about two weeks, packaged nicely. The scent is fresh and light, sweet flower-y, very pleasant. These scents seem to be popular in Western Europe, since I just came back from my vacation in Europe and I was surprised with similar scents in local soap and shampoo. I did not see anything similar to this in the U.S. yet.

Deodorant lasts all day. It does provide decent sweat protection, but you will get sweaty if you are going to work out or stay outside during hot summer day. The scent is very long lasting, it will definitely last throughout the day.

I was not very sure about this deodorant, but I bought based on the reviews. I sweat, I stink. The only deodorant without aluminum that would work temporally, not making me stink was Milk of Magnesia, however, once you sweat you have to wash and reapply again. It works, but the white stuff gets on your clothes and makes a mess. This one does not last 48hrs for sure, however, it does last until I start sweating on my workout. So I reapply a little bit more, before working out and holds well. My 12 years-old daughter, it is a mini-stinky-me, and it works pretty well for her and she is happy, because she does not want to have aluminum on her deodorant! I would recommend. It has a nice scent, and if you are not all day outdoors in a high humid environment such as in South Florida, you will like the results!

Although the wait for this was long, it was well worth it. The smell is not overly strong but really does last all day! during the summer I am a active out doors person an I am impressed with this product. The best part is for a natural deodorant it does not stain my clothes.

I have very dry skin and make up crepes under my eyes as a result. Yes, I've tried many other creams (specifically, every one olay has ever come out with); I've also tried setting it with different powders after watching youtube videos. For me, powder was the worst choice.

Since most beauty products cater to oily or combination skin, I imagine that those of us with truly dry skin are more of a minority and so it's reasonable that this won't work for a lot of people.

But if you're like me and you could probably cover your face in olive oil and think, "damn, now my skin looks nice", this might be for you. It is truly the only thing I've used that doesn't make my concealer or foundation crepe.

One reviewer compared it to Vaseline, which it is definitely not. However, I can see where she was coming from. It's thick and oily and just what my skin needs. It also lasts longer than any dermatologist would recommend keeping it for. Then I suggested to my 16 year old with acne, for her to try putting it on each morn and before bed. Her acne has all cleared up and her skin looks great.

Since I have a lot of thick hair, I typically let it air dry, as it takes too long for me to blow dry it out, and it gets too hot. (I can only get the rubber band around my hair twice.) My hair is frizzy and is somewhat wavy at the ends. It normally takes me 45 min to straighten my hair, after it has been air dried out. The Jose Eber Digital Straitening Brush cut down the time dramatically! It took me between 10-20 minutes to straighten my hair. After letting my hair dry out overnight, it took me 10 minutes to straighten my hair, and I did not have any hair products in my hair! It took me the maximum of 20 minutes, to straighten my hair, after being left in a braid and bun all day. During that time, I used thermal heat protectant, and when I use heat protectant, I don’t spray a large amount. I do a few quick spritzes on my entire head, and then brush it through.
As with any electrical equipment, read the instructions. The instructions were clear, and made the brush very easy to use. The digital display is easy to read and see. The instructions make it easy to switch the temperature setting from Celsius to Fahrenheit. The temperature settings are from 320 degrees Fahrenheit to 450 degrees Fahrenheit. The brush is not bulky, and it’s not heavy.
As recommended in the instructions, brush sections of the hair for easy and proper straightening. When I sectioned my thick hair, I was able to quickly straighten it. I used the straightener on the highest setting, and my hair did not smell like burnt hair. Normally when I use other straighteners, I am hesitant to start right next to the root, as I have been burned before from the steam of a typical hair straightener. I was able to safely and easily straighten my bangs with it, as the red silicone caps protect your scalp, and doesn’t burn your head. Even though I had the Jose Eber Digital Straightening Brush on the highest heat setting, my hair was not hot to touch. When using other typical hair straighteners on the highest setting, I tend to get the horizontal line from the flat irons’ plates idling a tad too long, on a section of the hair. Since this is a brush hair straightener, I did not have any horizontal lines! The brush made my hair smooth, and easy to brush through with my fingers. I love this straightening brush. It works wonders!
Easy to use.
The brush works great on thick hair.  I recommend this product.

I have lots of very thick curly to kinky hair and in five minutes on the highest setting my volume is reduced by half just by brushing my hair.  It would take longer to get it perfectly straight, but it's a relief not having to work with all that hair.

Could be that I got a brush with a defective on-switch but I would not take a chance on another one.

Maybe my flyaways are just bigger than the average person's, but I thought the wand was a little small. It's essentially the size of a lip gloss or mascara. I feel like the wand tip would work better if it had something like a mascara wand tip so it helps comb the wispies back. The stuff itself works well without leaving your hair looking or feeling oily. The application was a bit tedious and time consuming for me personally.

I have tried hair flyaway gel before that comes with a mascara wand but this one comes with a wand that looks like it would go to a lipgloss. I feel like the wand itself makes it messier to apply because you are just rubbing it on your hair instead of brushing it to catch all the flyaways. The gel itself works well but you just have to apply a little more pressure with the wand to get it to go where you want to go.

My daughter has frizzy hair, especially in the summer, and she was really hoping this would help. Well, it did but she'd probably use the whole bottle in a few days.

This bottle is about the size of mascara. It's on the small side. The applicator was nice, it worked well and was easy to use. My daughter has frizzy hair and was really looking forward to this. It does work, but it's such a small bottle!

Overall, it works well but there's cheaper and bigger sized alternatives out there. This is so expensive for what it is, currently $19.99 for a little 8 ml bottle. I just couldn't justify getting this again.

This would be okay for minor touch-ups but if you have frizzy hair, try something else that's cheaper, and bigger.

A fantastic cruelty free item to have in your purse. Takes away any flyaways that are driving you crazy! During in the summer I tend to wear my hair pulled back in a ponytail, and always find that I have those stray flyaway hairs. This easily and quickly takes care of them. Just pull out the wand, tame them down using the tip of the wand, and go about your business. Holds for the better part of the day. You will need to reapply every now and then, but it doesn’t leave your hair feeling oily or weighed down. Definitely some thing I’ll continue to use.

Ok so this entire tube fits in the palm of my hand. It’s like the size of a lip gloss or mascara. So, with that being said why is it so expensive???! I have a hard time getting past that fact. I thought oh boy this better be good for the price.

So this is pretty much identical in both applicator and size to a lip gloss. I like the idea of the applicator being mess free something you can carry in your pocket and do a quick touch up on the go without putting product on your hands. The gel itself isn’t sticky and doesn’t dry with any “crunch” to it. Which is both good and bad. It’s not overly heavy for quick touch ups. But for someone like me with really curly frizzy hair this provides no lasting power. You can hardly tell I used it a short while after application.

I’d say all in all you can buy a whole bottle of lightweight hair gel (basically all this is) for about 1/10 of the price. I wouldn’t purchase this in the future.

I have some baby hairs, some frizzy hairs and some wiry colored white hair that pokes out of my pony tail and blows up in the wind. This is definitely not for the frizzy or thick hairs. It did basically nothing on those. I used it on my very fine baby hairs and around my face and it smoothed the hairs down well and looked a lot more polished. I could have probably achieved the same result with hairspray. I assume this is for a quick fix and to carry in your purse. It only works on fine hair and not a great fit for me.

I was surprised to see that the applicator is a lambs ear type brush versus one with bristles, but it does the job! It smoothed my fly always down and once dry (it goes on wet), everything stayed in place despite some light winds. It won’t work in heavy wind, but it provides a light hold that isn’t crunchy.

It won’t hold big pieces, and it doesn’t last all day. But having said that, it lasts a long time in normal circumstances. Keep it in your purse for touch ups.

This succulent gel is my ‘saving grace’ when my locks of hair need that finishing touch of perfection! It is fantastic at pampering my hair with a subduing presence that sleeks down my unruly strains, trying to undo my groomed beauty. It was really important to me to find products that were cruelty free and when I wrote the seller to ask, Shelley got back to me right away and said yes they are a cruelty free company! EDITED: Tried to be descriptive in the title. This scrub is very interesting to me, because it is MUCH stickier than I thought it would be. I previously was using the Terre de Mars coffee/aloe scrub and I got GREAT results (soft, matte skin after washing off with near complete resolution of my frequent forehead breakouts), so I wanted to give this coffee product a try when I saw it for comparison. From a smell standpoint it's fine (like sweet coffee but with a saltiness to it), and texture-wise it does have some grit behind it to feel like you're getting a good scrub when you apply it (can see the sea salt). As I noted earlier though, it is QUITE sticky, and the dark color of the coffee can be a bit difficult to get off your skin (I follow the scrub w/ a cleanser and thorough rinse after which gets it all off without too much mess). I haven't used it long enough to say it's really making a big difference, but the few times I did use it I did feel like my skin was softer than before, so that's a good sign.

I didn’t like how the coffee grounds and the oil separate. The smell is pretty good, and it does feel good going on. It exfoliates well, but it does make a mess in the shower. I don’t think I would buy this again. I have used better body scrubs.
The other items in this line I liked a lot. This was unpleasant feeling and snaked more like first than coffee.

This doesn't smell like chocolate or coffee to me, it literally just smells like dirt. The exfoliant in this feels like hard sharp large chunks of rock salt. It's a hard pass for me especially at the current price of $40.

First of all, this is a salt scrub and not a sugar scrub. Salt and sugar have very different qualities. As someone who has tried many body and face scrubs: from sugar and salt to ground almond, from speciality stores to drug stores to homemade, this scrub performs well. It is a coarser scrub due to the salt. I was a little nervous about rinsing it down the drain in my tub, but I was glad to find that the coffee bean and cacao (listed in the ingredients) are incredibly fine and it is only the salt that is the rough material, so it dissolves and rinses away just fine. Because of the natural ingredients, there’s separation, but it can easily be mixed prior to use. I took a photo to show where the ingredients are located on the container. It was a little messy since the scrub is dark brown - it looks exactly like the product pictures. It leaves skin smelling slightly like pure dark chocolate. I scrubbed one arm and not the other to compare and it really gets rid of bumps and uneven skin texture. It was not irritating or too rough, it felt nice. Some sugar scrubs just dissolve quickly and are too greasy, but because these salt crystals are more coarse, they do scrub (hate to use the word scratch) away excess stuff on the skin’s surface. When mixed, it also was not too greasy and did not cause my tub to be left oily after showering off the scrub. I’m interested in seeing how this continues to improve my skin with continued use.

Glad I found this product but it definitely needs to be mixed before use! Make sure to clean the shower/tub after use because it will leave a mess behind if you're not careful with it. It's packaged really well so no leaks or anything. Smells great and leaves you feeling nice and clean!

I wanted to try the breathable nail polish. I prefer frosts or pearls, and pinks. My favorite polish is by another company in a rose gold.

The photos included for this polish clearly look rose gold. Sure, different monitors, screens, etc etc, but everything else has been spot on, EXCEPT this polish.

First off, I love the rubberized top. It makes it so easy to handle. The polish itself flowed well and went on smoothly.

My beef is the huge color difference. I've already opened it, I can't return it. It totally looks rosy and pearlized in the photos on Amazon. BUT, in reality, it is mauve, nearly purple. The color name is "Pinky Promise", so the minimum I expected was a shade of pink. They should change the name to "Purple Promise", which would be much more accurate. It is so different, I thought maybe I was sent the wron bottle. But the sticker on the bottom has the right name. Maybe someone messed with stickers?

It is not a horrible color, but not what I wanted, and very dark for me. Very disappointing. The quality is ok, but the shade is WAY off from the photo and name.

UPDATE: Found the weakness in this polish. Despite it being so dark, I wanted to test the "breathable" polish, as I'd never tried it. I have to say that it lasted really well. I put it on with no bottom or top coat, just the polish. It was still going strong, no chips or flaking, four days later.
Until I did a big batch of dishes.
I usually wear gloves to wash dishes (yes, sadly, we have no dishwasher where we live. It's like the 1950's). However, I wanted to test the polish, so wore my usual glove on my right hand, and no glove on the left.
Water, for prolonged time, is this polish's kryptonite! I added a photo. All the polish came off the ends when my nails got super wet and soft.
But I will say the polish lasted much longer than my usual brand (Hansens).
Pinky Promise is a beautiful color. It’s considered a metallic so it has depth but I love that it’s not dominated by glitter. It will easily become a new favorite for me.

I have tried a few products by this company that I didn’t cere for because of the synthetic fragrance added to their sensitive skin products. This one is the first that did not say it was for sensitive skin, but also has no added fragrance. There is a light scent due to the regular ingredients.

I like that this mask helps replenish the skin’s normal pH level and has good, quality ingredients for moisturizing the skin. Comes with 10 sheet masks you wear for 15-20 minutes and is similar to other Korean sheet masks. What I don’t like is that the mask is extra wide and covers a lot of my hair area. It also bags more than other masks around the nose area, so I have to keep pushing it down. Overall, it is a gentle mask that provides good moisture to the skin in the specified time.

I have tried many many face sheet masks. While I did not notice anything special about these ones while using them, I can still think they are a great option because: 1) They are affordable ($2 per mask) and 2) Ingredients are all safe and clean (more details below).

I have used them at night, right before bed, usually leave them on for 15 minutes. Once I removed them, my skin feels fresh. The following morning, I feel my face moisturized and soft. There is enough serum to apply on the neck and chest area. There is no need to rinse after using them. Great option to use after a facial. It covers pretty well all face. I had to fold the nose area because of a recent nose ring, but it does cover the nose as well.

Regarding the ingredients, I use skincare ingredient analyzers that follow the EWG, which individually rates ingredients from 1 to 10 (lowest to highest hazard). I was impressed to see all ingredients are rated EWG1. Another interesting fact around ingredients is that there are no parabens, sulfates, silicones, alcohols, allergens and fragrances (a very common ingredient that is highly hazard).

Expiration date: 2025 (3 years after received)
This mask is very soothing. It smells wonderful and leaves my face feeling moisturized and smooth.

This Vaginal Moisturizer - Vulva Balm - USDA Organic Aloe Free & Natural Vaginal Cream - Intimate Skin Cream - Reduce Vaginal Dryness, Itching & Burning - Estrogen Free Treatment - V. Harmony (1) will relieve a multitude of irritations caused by many different issues. One of the main irritations are pads or tampons. Every month, especially for a heavy period, menstrual pads can cause painful irritations, dryness, rashes, pain and itching. Then when you are into menopause, the irritations, dryness, rashes, pain and itching are a hundred times worse, due to heavy periods that can last forever.

There are many other issues that can cause constant irritations besides pads and tampons- if you’ve ever had a bad Urinary Tract Infection, where you are urinating frequently in pain, the rashes are unbearable. Having a weak bladder at times where you need a heavier pad or diaper causes more unpleasant rashes. It is so difficult to find a cream that will actually help with severe chafing, dryness, pain, itching and irritations. This V. Harmony Vaginal Moisturizer helps immensely with chafing and dryness. But when it comes to helping with severe rashes, itching and pain- make sure you refrigerate this first before applying, because you will be happy you did. Applying this cold is the best relief ever- the pain goes away immediately. Take the time to refrigerate the jar for maximum, instant relief! 5 STARS.
works really well - nice and soft and great for sensitive skin

What this is not: it is not a hormone replacement therapy, and you can't expect the same results as if it were. It is, however, a nice collection of organic oils and beeswax which combines to make a semisolid much lighter in feel than petroleum jelly but not a liquid. You need only a little dab - using too much could get messy. It softens at body temperature but doesn't turn into an oily liquid. It is quite nice and refreshing. It's an odd greenish color.

But the product is a bit confusing to me. It is for external vaginal use only. I don't know about you, but at what point is my vagina external instead of internal? It seems pretty internal to me. That makes it of limited use to postmenopausal women like me. Soothing and comforting, yes, but not really what most postmenopausal women need.
I've tried several brands of organic moisturizers, and liked them all. But they're expensive! This one is slightly thinner going on, but works very well. Recommended!

I've always heard that you shouldn't use oils and things like petroleum jelly in your lady parts. This is not for "lubrication" inside, but for surface treatment of dryness, itching, or irritation. I don't really have those problems, but do experience the normal most-menopausal issues of many women, which this IS NOT really designed to treat. I used prescription creams for that in the past, but worry about continued hormone use.

This is kind of heavy and pasty in the jar but does seem to dissolve on warm skin. I used it very sparingly and had no problems with residue on my underwear and it was soothing. I would be cautious of staining due to the Sea Buckthorn Oil, which is orange naturally.

Instructions recommend refrigeration for extra comfort to irritated skin, but it's not necessary for preservation. What is a concern of mine is contamination if using your fingers to get it out of the jar. It would be best to have a washable or disposable applicator/spatula to prevent this.

My limited experience with this has been positive. If used correctly, I feel that it is effective to sooth the fragile skin in your most private of areas.
This is a very good product. It works great- I reorder this on a regular basis. If you are going through menopause, this is very helpful, or if you just have dry, itchiness.

This plugs in so no batteries! Yay! I got this nail lamp to use for my resin crafts. It works really well. I can either scoot the UV resin item under the lamp or take off the removable top and put it back over the item. The top of the lamp comes off pretty easily, but not on accident. You have to kind of pull with purpose. It also goes back on easily. There are buttons for different times and settings. Pretty much plug and play. Light and easy to transport, also.

Finally, a UV light that I can fit my entire hand in including my thumb! The first thing I noticed when I took it out of the package was the multiple power ports on the back of the unit. It comes with a cable already to plug into any outlet but I guess if you wanted to use your own cord you could. I ended up plugging my nail drill/file into the back of the unit so I didn't have multiple things to plug into separate outlets. The lights go around the entire inside of the dome so you don't have to worry about your hand being flat. It has 3 different settings on the top for 30/60/90 seconds. I just watched the timer on the top of the unit that counts up every time you put your hand or foot in. I like that the entire unit is plastic and not metal. The light also shuts off when you remove your hand. Very nice and look forward to doing my nails again!
I am in total shock that this dryer cures so well!!! I have been a nail tech for 23 years and have paid hundreds for big name dryers!!! This one exceeds my expectations... job well done!

I really liked it, it is very easy to use and has an ideal size so that your hands or feet fit perfectly.  additional temperature and time graduation help to achieve a perfect drying of your polish additional brings a usb port that is a perfect ally to shit your phone.

[[VIDEOID:e02371a2deeb6caf85a39f901d2db221]] Very happy with this purchase. Works well with my gel polishes. It’s really convenient to have both UV and LED as a 2 in 1 instead of switching back and forth between both. This dryer is the perfect size to fit both hands. It does need a longer curing time between each polish coat but for the price, it’s good.

My other UV lamp stopped working and I was excited to get this one just to find that it is entirely defective. The timer on the outside works but the internal lights do not turn on no matter what I try. They are sending me another and I will return this one. Hope the next one is not as disappointing as this one.

So, why is a guy reviewing a UV nail curing lamp? I'm a finger style guitar player. Natural nails don't survive that kind of abuse, so builder gel and fiberglass nail wrap on my picking hand are a fact of life when I'm playing a lot.
This is a good curing lamp. It will do the gel by itself in 60-180 seconds, depending on thickness, and a little longer when fiberglass is involved.
It has buttons for 10, 30, and 60 seconds. A fourth button puts the lamp in half power mode if the curing gel is heating up too much for you.
It's big enough to get one of my large hands in. If you have smaller hands you might be able to get both in at the same time.
The bottom detaches from the top very easily, making it easy to clean the inside.
A wall wart power supply is included. No need to dig out an old phone charger.
My only gripe is the power claim. It says 72 watts. According to my watt meter, it's 23 watts on high, and 12 watts on low. That's plenty of power for an LED lamp, I just wish they'd be honest about it.
Bottom line, this is a good curing lamp that does the job.

This serum is great! I usually do chemical peels with hyaluronic acid so I was familiar with it prior to receiving it. I loved that it has a dropper attached to the bottle top which helps keep waste down! I'm usually awful about wasting product but the dropper allowed me to get what I need. For the selling price point, this is comparable to some of the more expensive products I've tried in the past. I have bad skin, acne prone with a whole heck of a lot of sun damage so I'm always looking for something that works and isn't going to cost an arm and a leg. After about 2 weeks worth of usage I noticed a difference in my skin; it was smoother and some of my lighter laugh lines were not as apparent. After about a month, I saw a difference in my deeper set wrinkles [forehead and under my chin] I plan to keep using this product in the future. The first week or so was a little tough, as my skin reacts poorly to new skin care regimens...I saw an increase in my oil secretion, but this is a typical reaction for me. After that first week my skin adjusted. I really enjoy using this serum, I love that it doesn't go on greasy and it dries very fast and does not react with my foundation so I can wear it under my daily make up with no issue. I'm glad that I was able to try this product for free in exchange for my honest review of it.

I would definitely purchase this product.

I usually apply a form of hyaluronic serum after i use a vitamin c serum (which i do after using toner), so when i saw the chance to try this particular brand of it for free as long as i left a unbiased review, i did so. i like trying out different brands anyways, plus i make my own, all because i know hyaluronics benefits help me as a male (you can research it online). most brands have hyaluronic as one of the top 3 ingredients, followed by some mix of their own within it. this has witchhazel and aloe as the main base (well it shows herbal infusion as the first ingredient but that could be anything, so as the first item it seems the actual herbs should be listed should someone be allergic), and after the hyaluronic comes items im familiar with and all are items i use on their own daily so thats good, and luckily the preservative is the last item in this so its at a minimum. for my face it went on with a nice thick consistency, and absorbed mostly within 15-20 minutes, as aloe for me can be a little shiny if applied too much. it worked as well as any good hyaluronic serum of brand name, but at a bit lower price. a bottle lasts me about a month when applied on face and neck. its a good one to price compare others of roughly same items in this serum.
It truelly works. It’s very light and you feel the tightness of your skin immediately. I love this product.

I decided to try this on my hands. First off, I’m not one to put just anything on my face without having tested it first, and second, I wanted to be able to compare for results. My hands are often dry, and the nice thing is they are pretty identical, so in this time, I applied the serum to only one hand.

I will say that the left hand which is the one I tested on, was softer and smoother than the right. However, as far as aging goes, I did not see a difference. My pores didn’t seem tighter, or my skin less wrinkly, and I did use it twice a day. I am 41, so I would think a target age for this, since I have little wrinkles, but not so many that my entire hand is covered in them. It may be that I would see results over a longer period of time, but I wanted to get my review in.

APPLICATION & USE
This ASNaturals Serum is a potent 20% Vitamin C paired with Hyaluronic Acid. It is suitable for daytime use under sunscreen and moisturizer. It dries down quickly and without a sticky residue, so the skin looks dewy and moist when it is used without makeup, and when given adequate dry down time or when the serum is used sparingly, it does not conflict with makeup or make too sticky of a base to wear foundation. It has a light feeling; it does not sting, and it has a very light scent that dissipates when dry.

INGREDIENTS
There are many vitamin C serums on the market, so when selecting a Vitamin C serum, I like to see what complimentary ingredients are used to enhance the power of the Vitamin C. The ASNaturals Serum has Hyaluronic Acid, Jojoba Oil, Aloe Vera and Witch Hazel. These ingredients all work in tandem with the Vitamin C to boost its' anti-aging properties.

Hyaluronic Acid is a super-moisturizer, it holds massive amounts of water compared to its weight and makes skin looks dewy, soft and plump. The high moisture content in the skin plumps wrinkles, so they seem softer, smoother, and less deep. In addition to giving a youthful appearance, the Hyaluronic Acid helps active ingredients sink deeper into the skin, which means the Vitamin C can make collagen on a deeper skin level, reaching deep wrinkles, age spots, redness, and discoloration.

Jojoba Oil and Aloe Vera both moisturize and heal skin. These ingredients give the skin a smooth and soft appearance while the Vitamin C goes to work on acne and dark brown spots and acne scars, healing and lightening the blemishes.

RESULTS:
Since this is a gentle Vitamin C Serum due to its' supporting ingredients, I can use this on more delicate skin areas such as my throat, decolletage, and shoulder blades, as well as the delicate undereye area. My skin has a subtle glow, and my skin tone is becoming evener. I am especially happy with the improvement in the look of some sun damage on my collarbone and upper chest area.

CONCLUSION: This is a great price for a 20% Vitamin C serum. It is suitable for Sensitive and dry skin for treating acne, brown spots, sun damage, scarring, and wrinkles.

I received this product in exchange for my honest and unbiased review. If you have any questions about my experience with it, leave it in the comments section below, and I’ll do my best to answer it!

For the price point, this is a great case for your powerbank. It is sturdy, decent quality and keeps your battery nice and snug. There are quite a few things to consider before buying though. For one, the case is way too big. I think you could fit two batteries in it, which I guess if you owned two, that would be great! But, for extra cords, etc. you definitely do not need a huge amount of space. With it being big, it is awkward to put into bags, etc. Another minor annoyance is the loop strap. It may be a personal preference but it is in an awkward location and almost gets in the way when zipping up your case. I wish it was removable.

So, if you're looking to more protection for your battery for cheap, look no further. This case will definitely protect your battery; just consider the above things before buying.

This is perhaps an extremely expensive product. Well, actually the cost of the tiara is decent. But the coronation party that she now wants is gonna cost a fortune. haha.
Seriously, this is a very attractive vintage, baroque style tiara. It looks like it was crafted by artisans of days long past. It's a solid metal construction, with exquisite details and beautiful adornments.
Attached are photos to show real world images of the tiara, with close ups of the design details and embedded gemstones.
We are very pleased and satisfied with the appearance, feel and quality of this ornate tiara/crown. It fully meets expectations. It deservedly earns a 4.75 - 5 star rating, with a very high level recommendation.

[[VIDEOID:dfc5eab74dc0df3d48cce0a4bd02263a]] A lot of the crowns I own come packaged in a box with some form of padding either paper or foam. This one was only wrapped in a plastic bag and it shows because the product arrived bent way out of shape and could easily been broken due to its poor packaging. I was able to bend it back but it seems like those spots are particularly weak now and could easily be snapped off. I would recommend buying things like this from other parties who package the product correctly, otherwise you may end up with something as pictured or worse. The color was pretty and it had good sparkle but for the cost for it to arrive damaged I’ve gotten similar in nice boxes for the same price.

This tiara is stunning. Even though it’s for play/dress up it’s very attractive. The tiara is mainly a rose gold color on the metal. It has fine detail around the headband of the tiara. Each delicate flower is antique looking. The metal is darkened in areas. The gemstones in the leaves are a light pink/purple color. The other gemstones are other various shades of purple. There’s a deep purple that is almost red and a purple that’s in the middle of the light and dark. The tiara is substantial. It’s not sharp despite looking like it has many sharp pieces to it. I will say a few of the rhinestones that set up on top of the metal decoration were bent. I was able to bend them back ever so slightly. Of course I worry too much bending may break the tiara.

It fits well on the head and it is quite comfortable. It’s a attractive tiara and definitely one that’s more for an adult or teen head. I wouldn’t consider something like this for a child. It’s definitely larger for a larger head.
I love the crown. The only thing that I did not like is that I ordered this for my baby shower and I received it broken.

The purple looks more like a brown to me but I like it. Jewel encrusted leaves and vines make up the main part of the crown and tear drop shaped jewels spike out from the top. This is not a full circle crown which makes it easier to fit on the head and keep in place. There are holes on each end to fix the crown in place. This crown is not too heavy but does have some weight. It seems to be well made. I would recommend it. Great for a special occasion or costume!

I purchased these blades to replace 3 year old blades in my Norelco Aquatec razor. The description says that they are OEM blades from Phillips, but I am now doubting the accuracy of that statement.

These new blades installed very easily in my razor, and I was looking forward to giving them a try. My first use started out ok, then I started to get random hair pulling. I gutted it out and finished shaving my entire face. I thought that they may need a 'break in' period, so I decided to give them a second try. The second try was just as bad as the first, but again, I gutted it out. I decided to give them a third try, but was so stressed just waiting for the unknown hair pull, I gave up. After the third failed attempt I decided to find new blades.

Lucky for me, I did find replacement blades from Phillips/Norelco from Target for around $35. I put in the new Phillips OEM blades from Target and have NOT had any hair pulling.

DO NOT waste your money on these blades. Spend just a little more and get original blades from Phillips. Your wallet and face will thank you.

I'm so amazed by boar bristle hairbrushes and how incredible they make hair look and feel.  This GAINWELL boar bristle brush is a wonderful, compact brush. It may be small but it works wonders on our family's hair.  It works through tangles without pulling or causing pain while leaving hair soft, shiny and manageable.  The compact size makes it perfect for travel, to keep in a purse, a school/gym locker, briefcase or even a pocket.  If you've never experienced a boar bristle brush, I HIGHLY recommend giving it a try. You can't be the price and the results will be worth it!  If, for some reason you're not satisfied, GAINWELL asks you to contact them for assistance. I can't imagine they receive a ton of calls with issues but its great to know customer service is a  priority!

I like it a lot!! Didn’t find any reviews before I bought it, but it has a very good price. When I receive it, I immediately liked it. This brush is well made and in a perfect size, not too big, so I can put it into my handbag. Very comfortable to brush my hair and makes my scalp feels so good!

This brush has been great for me and my toddler son due to its reasonable size and quality build. The wooden handle is ergonomic, and the longer bristles coupled with boars bristles make fast work of unruly hair. Both my toddler and I have wavy, relatively thick hair, and we're able to get it under control with this brush. It's priced right (under $10 when I got it), and the quality really seems higher than expected for that price range. Just be aware, when they say small, they mean small. My wife's standard sized hair brush is considerably larger. If you need something bigger, this may not be the best option, but if you have fairly short hair and are okay with a smaller brush, this one is great.

However, It detangles and brushes through my curls with ease. I also did not experience the typical loss of bristles I usually do with a boar bristle brush. Most animal hair brushes seem to shed for a while and then stop shedding. So far I have not had that problem.

I actually cannot believe this is priced at $7.29 because most boar bristles brushes of this size are in the $28 to $30 range. The price, coupled with the style, finish, and functionality of this hairbrush is outstanding in my opinion.

I bought this trimmer two months ago. I use it to keep my hair very short. I have not gone to a barber ever since I bought this. I simply turn the dial to set the guard to level 5 and cut all of my hair the same lenght. Definitely easy to use. On my short hair, I can probably get four complete haircuts in one charge. This is a good trimmer for those men who like to keep their hair very short all the way around. Use it two times and it would have paid for itself due to the fact that you were able to avoid going to a barber.
This is my second Norelco trimmer. My first one was a T6000 that I bought back in February of 2001. The battery stopped taking a charge four months ago, after almost 3 years of use. I called Norelco to have the battery replaced, and I was then informed that they do not replace the batteries on these trimmers since replacing the battery would cost as much as buying a newer unit. So, I ordered the newer T860 from Amazon. The T860 functions just like the older T6000. In addition, the T860 can also function as a corded trimmer, in the event the battery stops taking a charge. The service life of the trimmer can extend beyond the life of the rechargeable battery by using the cord. I am satisfied with it.
By the way, the reason why the battery got damaged in my older T6000 was that I kept the unit plugged in the charger stand for very long periods of time. I later learned not to do that, as that practice will damage the battery over time. Overcharging even a little seems to damage the battery over time. It's best to read the directions so you will know how to properly care for the battery. The battery basically will determine the life of the unit. The cutters do not wear out, from what I can tell. The motor seems durable. So the life of the unit is really how long you can keep the internal rechargeable battery working. Norelco's internal rechargeable Ni-Cad batteries can last a long time, if given proper care. They seem to be of good quality.
I had a Norelco 885 razor, and the battery was still taking a charge after nine years. The razor had the advantage of having a five level battery meter that tells you how much charge is left in the internal batteries. Basically, you want to wait until there is only a little charge left before you put the unit in the charger. It seems this trimmer is a bit different though. The instructions on the T860 unit say to completely drain the battery. Which would be a bit inconvenient. With the T860 trimmer, it takes 10 hours for a full charge. Recharge fully. That way, you can minimize the dreaded "memory effect" or voltage depression and extend the useful life of the rechargeable batteries. The rechargeable batteries are permanently soldered inside the unit. This trimmer unit, T860, does not have a charge meter. I refrained from getting the pricier unit with a charge meter in order to economize. However, my advice to you, if you're not too cost-sensitive, is to get a unit with a charge meter. That way, you will know when to charge the unit and when to remove the unit from the charger. That precise practice should help extend the life of the battery, and hence, the unit.

Indeed, it does the job. Would have benefitted from being waterproof so could be rinsed after use, but otherwise does just fine + the price is right. No battery indicator - I just give it a swift re-charge about one a month. Beware of changing settings and forgetting to reselect the most appropriate for the target area.....!

I bought this to trim both my hair and my beard since I keep both the same, very short length. So far, so good. I've had it now for 1.5 years and it's enabled me to keep the exact look I want all the time. It's already saved me money from getting haircuts and since it only takes me me 15-25 minutes to do my head and beard I save a lot of time too. I like the multiple settings....the choices for length are very satisfactory.  My only complaint is that Norelco claims the blades are self sharpening but I've noticed that the trimmer has gotten less efficient over time and that it now takes longer to trim my hair and beard.  Having said that, my needs are fairly unique and this product meets those needs very well.

Wow! I should have bought one of these long ago! It's totally worth every penny after you use it a few times. There is NO need to get the next model up if all you want is a good shave. The next model up (the T990 I believe) charges in 1 hour vs. 10 hours for this model, and it has an LCD screen to show battery life. For as often as you'll use this trimmer, plugging it in overnight while you're sleeping is not that big a deal. This model doesn't have an LCD screen to tell you battery life, but do you really wanna pay more than double just for a quicker charge and a display of battery life? Not me!
The guard on the trimmer is smooth and glides easily over your skin. The T860 trims effortlessly - never snagging, pulling, or getting clogged with your hair. Battery life stays consistent until the last minute before it's completely drained. To eliminate hair's static attration to the rubber dial used to change cutting length, spray it with a quick spritz of Static Guard. Otherwise, just rinse it off when you're done; the hair rinses off easily with water.
This trimmer is made to trim facial hair, but it works GREAT on the legs, chest, stomach, and any other areas you'd imagine shaving! The 9 different settings insure that you keep the hair on, but under control...nice and tidy appearence. We all know how hairy we guys can get! I like to use a #3 on my legs, but you'd want to start out with a 6, then go DOWN ONE LEVEL AT A TIME to ensure that you don't cut TOO MUCH OFF.
DO NOT USE THE GUARDLESS TRIMMER WITHOUT READING THE DIRECTIONS! I nipped my skin (drawing a little blood) several times. Read directions and see illustrations for proper use without the guard. In any case, I do not recommend using it guardless in sensitive areas as it can be painful.
Anyway, if you're wondering whether you should buy this trimmer, DO. You will NOT regret the INVESTMENT! It saves so much time!

... there's a few things that Norelco needs to change. First, the zoom ring, because it's made of rubber, tends to attract hair like a magnet attracts metal. Cleaning hair off of there is a MAJOR pain!! It'd be a hell of a lot easier to clean if it was made of plastic. Secondly, the cleaning brush they include is too small, and its design ain't that ergonomic. And why does it take 10 hours to charge up? Of course, I guess the average person doesn't use a trimmer that often, so I'm thinking that won't be a big deal. Overall, though, this product works as advertised. If you just want to "get the job done", and could care less about all that fancy, high tech stuff, then you'll get your money's worth with this trimmer.

The 860T is all that Norelco says it is.  I was worried that the "Acu-Control system" would be fragile and gimmicky, but Norelco has proven me wrong!  This trimmer delivers a precise, consistent shave every time.  It is easy to use and the controls have a solid feel to them giving you complete control over your beard and moustache.  I also like that Norelco gives you the option of corded or cordless shaving with the 860T.  This is as good as it gets.

I love this soap! It has definitely calmed down my acne (which is bull that I am still having to deal with it in my late 30's >:/ ) but I also have overly sensitive skin and I had not had a reaction to this at all. Even though it has bits in it to exfoliate they do not irrate my skin and it does not leaving my skin feeling dried out nor does it leave a nasty coating on my skin either.

I use this soap as my go to nightly cleaner to get all the dirt and grime off my face. I soap it up in my hands and lather it on as I feel the exfoliate bits in it would be too harsh for every day cleaning (especially with my already sensitive skin) so I only use the bar directly on my face once a week for a good deep down clean.

I also cut down the bar, a nice palm sized section for my nightly face cleanse and then rest stays in my shower. I do recommend that you keep the bar on a breathable soap dish (I use those seafoam kinda looking, all natural ones) whether you have it by the sink or in the shower as it will help the bar stay nice and clean and dry out quicker so it keeps longer. Definitely do not keep in under the shower head as the dripping water will only errode the bar that much quicker.

If you keep the bar dry when not in use it will last you for quite a while so it helps with the expense.

I am really happy with this soap as I said, I have seen a good difference in my acne and I now do not break out as much. It also just give you a good clean feeling with no residue and the lemon honeysuckle scent is very pleasing and not over powering at all.

I am now placing my THIRD order for Fresh Balls. A 3-pack. This stuff works SO incredibly well, and each bottle lasts a little longer than a month.

The product goes on like a lotion, and when it dries it works like powder, except you don't have the mess that powder leaves. I've been using powder for MANY years, my wife even giving me a "powder puff" to apply the powder under scrotum, etc. Obviously, the powder goes into the air and lands everywhere.

With Fresh Balls, I dry the area very well, to start, often even using a hair blow dryer. I take about a dime size amount and rub it on the left side of my scrotum. Rub another dime size on the left side. Rub a nickel size amount underneath, and a little on the "top" where my penis might hang. I don't want to put any directly on the shaft in case my wife and I get intimate later that day and it happens to go in her mouth. Finally, I put some underneath my scrotum, at the top and between my legs, where they touch together. Basically, any where I feel that sweaty feeling throughout the day. I get dressed immediately after application. The lotion dries in a few minutes (yes, at first it was uncomfortable with wetness where I wanted it dry, but as I said, it dries quickly). I am sweat free ALL DAY LONG. This stuff is amazing!

No powder mess. No need for re-application. Best of all: it works!

With four cats and a large dog, I am always looking for good grooming tools. I liked the idea of this brush, but the actual product really wasn't all that. First of all, this thing is much larger than any other slicker style brush I have. This is a great feature for my large dog, but it was just ridiculous trying to groom my cats with this large, unyielding wire brush. So, not a good choice for the cats.

Unfortunately, not a good choice for my dog either, as she has a short coat with little to no undercoat and she was really uncomfortable with wires dragging on her skin. She's more of a rubber curry comb type gal, I guess. Besides the size and wire bristle problems, the plastic itself felt a little brittle and cheap and when you add in the mechanics of retractable bristles... I think higher quality material would have been a better choice because that slider for the bristles is very basic. Finally, while I loved the idea of the easy-to-clean retractable bristles, they really aren't necessary and if those wires become crooked or bent it will cause all kinds of problems with the retraction. I've made it decades by just pulling the fur out of my slicker brushes-- it literally takes 2-3 seconds-- and while the thought of retractable bristles is nice, it totally isn't necessary. It's not a practical tool for me and doesn't work for any of my animals due to its size and the wire bristles. It also doesn't seem terribly well-made nor is it made of high-quality materials, and for the price it should be.

I have a rescued teacup poodle that is a frightened little diva when I try to groom her.  I don't think the people who took care of her were nice or gentle with her in any way.  Poor little thing is only 4.5 pounds and she's fairly old and toothless so it's not like she'd turn and bite anyone trying to keep her looking like the pretty little girl she is.  I got this brush for her fine, curly hair.  She is a sweet little girl, but will "bleat" if she thinks you intend to hurt her and the first time I put a brush to her, she was shivering like I was going to do something bad to her.  I talked to her and took my time and by the time I was done, she was relaxed and let me work on her a little at a time.  My other furgirl is an older, rescued papillion and because her fur is straight with no undercoat, this brush works great on her.  She doesn't mind the brush at all and I think she likes how it lightly "scratches" her skin at the same time. Great brush for my two old girls!

The best part about this brush is that you push the button on top, the teeth retract, and you just wipe off the fur! Push the button again, slide it forward, and the teeth lock in place, ready to start grooming.

I have always liked slicker brushes for grooming short haired cats and as a way to control the shed on longer haired dogs, but it was almost impossible to clean out all of the fur. The retractable pins solve the problem! This brush is even easy to use with arthritic hands!

My Siamese cat with short, thick fur, adores this brush! Since he doesn’t groom a lot, I need to. My medium to long haired cat doesn’t like any brush, but tolerated this one.

Great for creating suds and not wasting those thin little remnants at the end of a bar of soap. I will say the plastic nubbin things don’t always stay on ribbons and you have to fish the loop out of the mesh before you can hang it it up again. But it is a zillion pack for a low price, so I can’t complain.

I've been using liquid body wash years but started thinking about the plastic waste from the bottles and went looking for a solution that would allow me to use bar soap but not end up with the slivers left over. This seems like a reasonable compromise. The mesh bags hold the soap and allow you to use all of it, down to the very last tiny piece. They foam up nice and the mesh bag provides a bit of scrubbing like I'd get from a standard shower puff. It's a bit tricky to use when switching from hand to hand as you have to try and keep the drawstring closed so the soap doesn't fall out but the drawstring is what allows you to hang the bag after your shower, which keeps it from getting sticky and covered in slime. That's the reason I went with mesh instead of a natural, woven material as a lot of the comments were that the bags disintegrated quickly and got sticky and gummy because they couldn't dry properly between uses.

These seem sturdy enough like they'll last through several bars of soap. And the pack of 20 means I'll have enough for me (a single person) to last for awhile.

The reason I deducted a star is the excessive packaging. The irony for me is that I got these to get away from buying plastic bottles (that can be recycled). These came individually wrapped, wrapped together in another bag, inside a bigger bag - none of which can be recycled. Seems a bit excessive for mesh bags.
Very nice!

The baggies came very quickly, which was great, but I’m not sure they are actually anything special for using for soap. They are just thin nylon with a ribbon on top to pull shut. That’s fine though since they are so cheap. My biggest concern is that they came tied up in a little grocery bag which was then put into a regular clear bag for products. Lots of plastic and a bit questionable…

I recently stayed at a high end hotel that had a mirror just like this in every single room. I loved it so much that I came home after my travel and starting looking for one. I found them at several home type stores, but the cost was over a hundred for each one I found. I held off thinking eventually I will find one at a better price. I came across the Kenley Wall Mounted Magnifying Makeup Mirror on Amazon at half of what I had seen elsewhere.

I had the opportunity to purchase the Kenley mirror at a promotional price in exchange for an honest and unbiased review. I immediately
jumped at the chance.

The mirror came a few days ago. I waited till today to install when my husband could help me. The mirror came with almost everything you need to install the mirror - including the screws and anchors. For tools, we used a level and a cordless screwdriver. The installation instructions were easy to understand and they included drawings. We were able to install the mount in about five minutes.

The mirror itself is very nice and well made. One side is regular and the other is 3 times magnifying. It is a chrome silver. There is a LED ring in the inside and in between the mirrors. It requires 4 - AA batteries. You have to unscrew one side of the mirror to install the batteries. It is easy to unscrew and screw back on. You do want to make sure that the mirror is screwed back on tightly. The LED lights are turned on my a switch on the outside of the mirrors.

The LED light is great, with the combination of the either mirror. Plucking my brows was easier than ever before on the magnifying side with the LED light turned on. The mirror both turns and flips. The bracket has an extending arm, so that you can manipulate the mirror to wherever you need it to be. It folds up nicely to be stored against the wall. The mirror is also the perfect size for a mounted mirror. In my picture below you can see the mirror is size relation to an outlet in my wall.

This is exactly what I wanted, from the moment I saw a similar mirror at the Hotel Philips in KS City. I strongly recommend it!

Ever since I used one of these mirrors at a hotel the past year, I have been looking for one of these mirrors, finally I found one that looked half decent on amazon, and I pulled the trigger. After using this mirror for a bit I can say that the quality may not be hotel quality, but it does the job just fine, and works exactly how I wanted it to work, will be using it for the next few months and will give a more detailed review after some extensive use.

Product Description
Ideal bathroom mirror
Make shaving and applying make up easy with the Kenley Extending Mirror with LED light. This double-sided 3x magnification mirror tilts and swivels so you can get the perfect angle for whatever you're doing. The extending arm goes from 7 to 24 inches with a gentle tug, so you can easily tuck this wall-mounted mirror away when it's not in use, and pull it out to where you need it.

Up close and personal
With a diameter of 7", this Kenley Extending Mirror is large enough to be easy to use but small enough to be unobtrusive. An elegant chrome finish will make it a feature in any bathroom. The soft surround lighting provides glare-free illumination with the help of 12 LED bulbs. Long life technology means you should never need to change a bulb. Installation is simple as there are no wires involved. The lights run on 4 standard AAA batteries (not included).

I got it about a week ago. It may be a bit too soon to write a review but...:-)... First of all, I should mention that I don't have a problem skin (it is pretty good actually). However, my skin (which is normal) is allergic to a lot of cosmetics. Olay's creams and serums plus Dermaglow's NuVectin have been the major part of my skin care routine. Unfortunately, Dermaglow discontinued NuVectin (which had a very high concentration of peptides). Being very disappointed, I thought I would try to find a replacement (hopefully). And when I came across "DNA Code-No..." products I thought maybe my prayers were answered..lol... However, I was a bit skeptical about it having all the right ingredients... hmmm... I thought maybe just an "angel dusting". However, I still wanted to give it a try... At the same time, I also ordered the "DNA Code-No...Solution" one to add to my "Olay Regenerist".

Here is my standard skin care routine: I start off with Olay's serum followed by "DNA Code-No Needle Alternative-Argireline NeuroPeptides ..." ... after about 10 mins, I apply the mixture of " DNA Code-No...Solution + Olay Regenerist" for an added moisture (at least). This product is not oily at all . So far no allergies.. It may be just my imagination but I think I notice some improvement of my crow's feet already.

So, so far so good. I hope this product will deliver (like the discontinued NuVectin did for me many years) and I will keep ordering it on Amazon... I will try to update my review after about a month of use.

I bought this at a local market a year or so ago. Worked fine for a while but just recently the spring mechanism which grips the blade cartridges has weakened and as a result the cartridges fall off even during a light shave. Total junk.

I think I need to stick with my 5 blade razor. This razor is not only difficult to hold & is made of a hard slick plastic with no grippers, but doesn't shave as well as my 5 blade razor. The style is nice, but the functionality is not.

I really like the razer. Yes, yes, I agree that the handle can get slick and you might drop it. I have nocked it a number of time off my shelf in the shower to drop 5' on to our stone tile floor with no damage. I am not saying that just the right drop will not brake it, I am just saying that it has held up for me. even when the blades on the top are popped of the top and through across the shower. I have seen that they do now make one with a rubber handle, but have not seen it sold here on Amazon. yet. As for the shave, it is the closet I have ever had. I have tied electric rip and pull (that is what they feel like) to all sorts of blade razers. This is the best so far. I can shave with or against the grain with no issue. Yes, I agree it is a little more expensive and the blades are a little more, but I feel it is worth it and so does my wife.

The 7 blades works really well for long strokes. For example shaving down your cheek or legs.

More blades mean cleaner slave, but clogging is an issue. Very prevalent with this shaver

I get irritation and cuts when trying to glide around contours of skin. May be my skin is used to the Gillette flex ball technology?

Grip is not good. Very smooth to the touch, but not very practical in use. Hand tends to gravitate and slide up toward the top while using.

For me, it's not a comfortable shave.

These are the worlds OKAYEST razors nothing spectacular or over the top. But for 6.99 at my  Fred Meyer store  is pretty hard to pass up even ifbits for one time. Seven blades shaves closer then my 4 blade and they last about two weeks longer. I'm not getting them on here for double the price! But just thought I'd give my 2 cents
